column7: As a result, David becomes friends with several people.

column3: Rebecca loved dogs.

column7: After that they walked back along the shore to go home.

column3: Jim worked as a chef at a 4-star restaurant.

column3: Carl is crossing the street with his seeing-eye dog.

column6: He decided to take his chances on a job he would have to apply for.
column7: After a few months, Bob ended up in the job he wanted.

column3: Joey is a thief who has been stealing from houses.

column6: After a minute inside the home, Joey was attacked by the dog.
column7: The dog was able to scare Joey off and keep the family safe.

column3: Sven did not like to drink alcohol under any circumstances.

column7: Unfortunately, the wine was not tasty enough to change Sven's mind.

column7: When he got home, Tristan was finally able to make his sandwich.

column3: Colin worked as an on-call electrician.

column7: Adrian was very skilled, however, and landed the plane safely.

column7: Rudy ended up having to go to the hospital for his injuries.

column3: Crystal is a professional babysitter.

column6: Frustrated, Crystal quickly cleaned up the mess.
column7: When the parents got home, Crystal was exhausted from her day.

column6: Joan realized that a deer must have eaten her precious flowers.

column3: Marsha was a bookworm and a librarian.

column6: Samantha decided she would leave the hair curlers in overnight.

column6: Her new bikini was a bit big on the top, so she could not wear it.

column6: The pie was a complete hit, and people urged her to make it again.
column7: Mary decided she would make the pie a regular item in her bakery.

column3: It was Jessica's birthday.

column5: Three cars have been ticketed.
column6: A tow truck came by and took one of the cars.

column5: A week after that i saw the constable come by and remove the notice.
column6: He said the law required sufficient notice of eviction.
column7: The next day, maintenance staff removed the unit's contents.

column5: They broke up, but he refused to move.
column6: She gave him an eviction notice and he laughed.
column7: She called the police and they moved him out.

column3: Today was street cleaning day.
column4: Any car parked across from our building would be towed.

column6: A woman ran quickly across the street.
column7: She was lucky to avoid being towed.

column5: My son read two books and got two tickets.

column7: My son grew up to be a Red Sox fan and a reader.

column6: I was embarrassed and went on a diet.

column4: He and his wife have an 18 month old boy.

column6: My nephew's family is upset as he is not inviting them over.
column7: They feel the wife is possessive.

column4: He became a pitcher.
column5: He gave up eight runs in his first game.
column6: He got depressed after the game.
column7: We bought him pizza to cheer him up.

column5: His daughter was getting married.

column5: He was unsure if his daughter was coming today.

column7: Bob waved goodbye and went home.

column4: He is moving down to KY soon.
column5: His wife and daughter live there.
column6: His wife is a hoarder, but said she was throwing things out.
column7: He went down last week and found a complete mess, depressing him.

column5: My friend told me he was very low, being in pain.

column7: He thanked me via email.

column4: He often goes on temper tantrums.
column5: One day he drew a picture while at a family party here.
column6: It was a drawing of a sad child holding a knife.

column4: He said the water was warm.
column5: He spent hours on the beach.
column6: He got a sunburn, even after wearing sun screen.
column7: His back is sore today.

column4: He saw an overweight person and reacted.
column5: He asked me why people cannot control their weight.
column6: I told him it is very hard to not eat in this society.
column7: I think Charlie is getting senile.

column4: He used to hit her when he got drunk.
column5: The police were called in twice for disturbances.
column6: One night he almost destroyed her apartment.
column7: He got sent to jail and she has not seen him since.

column4: He was 20 years older than his wife.
column5: His bride had a large family.
column6: During the wedding, the bride's brother yelled at his ex-wife.
column7: Luckily the wedding ended without fisticuffs.

column5: He never went away for vacations, and kept her at home.
column6: After his death, she went to Aruba and had a great time.
column7: We were glad she was able to enjoy herself.

column5: He celebrated the capture of the Tsarnaev terrorist by shooting up.
column6: Unfortunately, he overdosed and died.
column7: He was cremated a few days later.

column5: Her parents said they did not want one.
column6: Maria took a kitten home anyway.
column7: The parents were angry, but the cat is still there.

column5: The man left her and went back to his wife.
column6: Recently she posted a hotel room photo suggesting otherwise.
column7: The photo has people gossiping.

column6: My wife said she had not changed her mind.

column6: The daughter was in a dress but the son's pants had fallen down.
column7: She posted the photo anyway.

column4: Her granddaughter was visiting her.

column6: She said her granddaughter was buying her lunch.
column7: I wished her a good day.

column7: Facebook photos showed him looking happy.

column3: My cousin's son got married in December.

column7: Harriet had enough of an old bottle to give my wife a glass, however.

column7: I am starting to wonder if Bob will be ok.

column5: One day he went to Maggiano's restaurants with coworkers.
column6: He vowed to eat salad, but ate a huge pasta dish instead.

column7: He decided to not ask her out.

column3: Yesterday we went to Tanglewood.

column3: I was wiping my hands in the bathroom.

column3: I use cleaning wipes a lot.

column5: Recently my wife bought some environmentally friendly wipes.
column6: I was unsure, as they did not guarantee to kill any viruses.
column7: They seem to be working, though.

column3: I was working on an mTurk hit today.
column4: I received credit, but got a note detailing grammatical errors.
column5: I was mortified, and vowed to be more careful.
column6: I installed Grammarly in an effort to be better.
column7: I hope this works out.

column3: I had a stroke in 2011.
column4: I survived with hemiparesis.
column5: We visited friends in December of 2012.
column6: My friend encouraged me to keep exercising to overcome hemiparesis.
column7: I told him I had given up, saddening my daughter.

column3: I used to sell things on eBay.
column4: I would check the recycle bins outside our dumpster.
column5: One day a person left a hurling stick.
column6: It had some chips but was still solid.
column7: I sold it on eBay for $80.

column3: My sister in law is named Bertha.
column4: In 1996 Hurricane Bertha hit New England.
column5: One of Bertha's coworkers made fun of her name.
column6: She told him she did not like his humor.
column7: He apologized.

column3: My friend is a used bookseller.
column4: In 2004, i helped him pick up books he bought from a library.
column5: The person in charge sternly told me there was no cherry picking.
column6: I cherry picked behind her back.
column7: My friend made $100 from the sale.

column3: My friend Joe formed a soccer nonprofit in 2008.
column4: It gives soccer lessons to immigrant and poor kids in Manchester, NH.
column5: In July, the organization rented a soccer stadium for a week.
column6: They gave free coaching to 100 children.
column7: I intend to donate to my friend's group.

column3: I just finished reading Infinite Jest.
column4: It is a 1,078 page novel set mostly in Brighton, my home.
column5: After reading the novel I drove through Brighton.
column6: I stopped at places mentioned in the book.
column7: It was a fun, if bizarre tour.

column3: Yesterday we went to Tanglewood.
column4: It is the summer home of the BSO.
column5: The BSO played a modern piece, then Mozart.
column6: It ended with a Beethoven symphony.
column7: The audience gave the conductor a standing ovation.

column3: Last night, our headboard came loose.
column4: It made creaking sounds.
column5: I am disabled and cannot use two hands.
column6: I jammed a pillow down, wedging the headboard.
column7: The headboard is no longer creaking.

column3: I was doing an mTurk hit on food.
column4: It mentioned canned fruit cocktail several times.
column5: I remembered eating this food as a child.
column6: I ordered a few cans of fruit cocktail.
column7: It tasted very good.

column3: My son received an official looking letter.
column4: It requested that he change his voter registration address.
column5: I was about to give it to him.
column6: I looked and saw it was from a non profit political group.
column7: I ignored the letter.

column3: In 2014, I read the complete Mahabharata.
column4: It was 6,000 pages long.
column5: It took me two months, at 100 pages a day, to finish it.
column6: After I finished I bought Ganges River water online.
column7: I proudly showed it off on Snapchat.

column3: In 1987 we moved to Chandler Pond in Brighton.
column4: It was a twenty minute walk to the BC Green Line stop.
column5: One day I saw a person walking through the condo parking lot.
column6: I followed as he walked to BC in only ten minutes via a short cut.
column7: I was very excited to not have to walk so far.

column3: My wife and I like jazz vocalists.
column4: Jane Monheit is one of our favorites.
column5: Last year we bought tickets to her concert at Sculler's.
column6: There was a fire, and the concert was cancelled.
column7: We have looked for concerts in the area, and none have been scheduled.

column3: In 2000, we visited our friends in Buffalo.
column4: Joey was about ten months old.
column5: He was very shy and did not want to see us.
column6: He put his hands over his eyes, hoping to hide.
column7: Everyone laughed about Joey.

column3: I bumped into Sally and her four year old Joey today.
column4: Joey was going to draw on the sidewalk.
column5: Sally asked me if I wanted to accompany them.
column6: As I was retired, I readily agreed.
column7: I sat and watched Joey draw, and savored the friendliness.

column3: My sister in law has been smoking for 46 years.
column4: Last month her doctor recommended a CT scan of her lungs.
column5: She was concerned about the results.
column6: The results were good, and she was relieved.
column7: She continues to smoke, however.

column3: I sell things online.
column4: My computer illiterate friend wanted to sell his tool cabinet.
column5: I posted it on Craigslist.
column6: I sold the unit for $100.
column7: My friend bought me a beer.

column3: In 1971 i ate my first bagel.
column4: My family is Chinese and did not eat Western food much.
column5: We lived near a Jewish deli.
column6: My brother bought a toasted bagel and gave me half.
column7: I was hooked on bagels, and eat them all the time.

column3: We went to an amusement park in 1992.
column4: My son was too small to ride a roller coaster.
column5: We found an old car sitting on the ground.
column6: We sat in it and raised our hands.
column7: My son posted the photo on FB 24 years later.

column3: Hurricane Gloria hit New England in September of 1985.
column4: My wife was eight months pregnant.
column5: Her sister called wondering if hurricanes caused early labor.
column6: My wife said she felt fine, and did not go into labor.
column7: Our daughter was born in October, full term.

column3: I work for a transit authority.
column4: One day a man came in demanding to speak to a manager.
column5: I went to talk to him, but he said he would talk outdoors.
column6: He wanted us to stop using artificial lighting in our subway cars.
column7: I said I would talk to the General Manager, and he left.

column3: I am Chinese.
column4: One day an eight year old boy made fun of my race.
column5: I stopped my bike and went to the boy.
column6: I offered to rearrange his face.
column7: He ran away, scared.

column3: My son in law played with knives when he was ten.
column4: One day he was flipping a knife.
column5: It landed in his leg.
column6: He did not tell his father, who was strict.
column7: He waited for his mother to come out of the shower to help him.

column3: Our neighbors were poor grad students.
column4: One day Joe figured out how to steal cable service.
column5: He went to the boiler room and hooked up the cable to his unit.
column6: The cable company came by a month later and disconnected Joe's cable.
column7: He got away with a warning they will prosecute for theft next time.

column3: We had conservative Jewish neighbors in the building.
column4: One day their car was vandalized.
column5: The headlights were smashed.
column6: As it was Saturday, they could not pick up the pieces.
column7: I picked up the pieces and threw them away.

column3: We live by the edge of a pond.
column4: One day we were sitting on the grass.
column5: A big toad appeared on the grass.
column6: I picked it up and had a photo taken.
column7: The kids played with the toad before releasing it.

column3: My wife's sister in law was rebellious growing up.
column4: One day, when she was sixteen, she went out.
column5: She told her mom she was visiting a friend.
column6: Instead, she went to a party until 3 AM.
column7: When she came home her father screamed at her.

column3: In 1999, we decided to go to Tanglewood.
column4: Our car was dying.
column5: I saw an ad online for a bus trip to Tanglewood, by MIT.
column6: Even though I was not affiliated they let me buy tickets.
column7: We had a good time sitting with geniuses on the bus.

column3: We went away all day yesterday.
column4: Our cat eats in the afternoon.
column5: Our son volunteered to drop in.
column6: He came at two pm and put cat food into the tray.
column7: We got home at night and saw the cat had refused to eat.

column3: My brother lives in a densely populated part of the city.
column4: Parking is at a premium.
column5: He had rented a spot for $175 a month.
column6: Last week he lost the spot as a building was going up on the lot.
column7: He is now scrambling to find a parking spot.

column3: My friend Bob is 99 years old.
column4: Recently he fell twice.
column5: Although he was unhurt, his daughter was concerned.
column6: She asked about assisted living, but he did not want to go.
column7: She is trying to talk him into going.

column3: We use Peapod quite often.
column4: Recently peapod changed their website.
column5: I did some shopping, then signed off.
column6: Peapod said my cart was saved, but in fact it was not.
column7: I am mulling over using another service.

column3: In 1999, we went to the beach with our friend Sally.
column4: Sally was 24, with a two year old son, Dan.
column5: We drove to Nahant Beach.
column6: A dog came up and ate Dan's favorite ball.
column7: I talked to the owner and got her to pay Sally $5 for the ball.

column3: I sell used books on amazon.
column4: Several times a month, I have to review pricing.
column5: I adjust pricing or close listings based on the market.
column6: Today I had to close ten listings.
column7: The used book market is very competitive.

column3: My daughter's college friend Sharyn smoked a lot.
column4: Sharyn's sister Sue got married shortly after graduation.
column5: A year later Sue had a baby.
column6: Sue told Sharyn she could not see the baby if she smoked.
column7: Sharyn gave up smoking.

column3: My friend's daughter lives in CA.
column4: She broke up with her boyfriend.
column5: She had a fight with him over cheating, and slapped him.
column6: He called the police who arrested her for assault.
column7: The DA's office said they will drop the charge.

column3: My son in law's sister Clea went to college.
column4: She failed a few courses.
column5: In her senior year she moved off campus, and partied a lot.
column6: She ended up failing three out of four courses the first semester.
column7: She never finished, and did not get a diploma.

column3: My coworker is a health nut.
column4: She got into drinking green tea instead of coffee.
column5: One day her dentist noticed a slight green tinge in her teeth.
column6: She was told it was the green tea.
column7: Now all she drinks is water.

column3: My daughter's old college friend Sue is a lesbian.
column4: She got married in 2014.
column5: Last year, my daughter heard from another friend, Sally.
column6: Sally claimed Sue made a pass at her, despite being married.
column7: My daughter said some of the group have started staying away from Sue.

column3: My sister in law never throws things away.
column4: She had a heavy 1950 carpet sweeper.
column5: It still worked.
column6: I tried to sell it on eBay for her but was unsuccessful.
column7: She kept it in her closet.

column3: Sally worked as a part time clerk in my wife's company.
column4: She had a master's degree from Boston College.
column5: She did not a good job, claiming the work was beneath her.
column6: She did so badly the company's owner fired her.
column7: Sally is still not working, according to her social media posts.

column3: My son in law's aunt, Sally was recently evicted.
column4: She had not paid her rent in a year.
column5: Sally and her adult son moved in with her mother.
column6: Sally's sister, who owns the apartment, was not pleased.
column7: She asked Sally to move out by the end of the month.

column3: My daughter's girlfriend got arrested last night.
column4: She had recently broken up with her boyfriend.
column5: She found out he was cheating on.
column6: She reached for his phone and slapped him.
column7: He called the police and had her arrested.

column3: My former coworker became a fitness trainer.
column4: She lost a lot of friends to drugs.
column5: Last week she posted on Facebook that she was in a benefit run.
column6: Funds were to go to addiction treatment.
column7: I donated $25.

column3: My wife drove home from work the other day.
column4: She said she put the windshield wiper on for a minute.
column5: The wiper left a big black mark on the windshield.
column6: She got some Windex and sprayed the windshield.
column7: She was able to erase the mark.

column3: One Saturday night my wife went down to get the mail.
column4: She saw our neighbor Charlotte in the lobby.
column5: Charlotte lives in the same building.
column6: Charlotte had locked herself out and was waiting for a locksmith.
column7: We invited her into our apartment to wait.

column3: My niece lives in Greenfield, MA.
column4: She used to go to Maine every summer with her parents.
column5: This year she started working.
column6: As a result, she could go to Maine for only a few days.
column7: She said she did like growing up.

column3: My sister in law's son moved to the suburbs.
column4: She wants to visit, but hates highway driving.
column5: I told her the commuter rail train stops five minutes away.
column6: She told me she does not like mass transit.
column7: I told her the train was comfortable, to no avail.

column3: My friend's mother was disinherited.
column4: She was a Pole who married an Italian.
column5: Her father was very well to do.
column6: Later in life, he reconciled with his daughter.
column7: When he died, he left her $1,000,000.

column3: My coworker went to Cancun in 1992.
column4: She was a senior in high school.
column5: When she got to Cancun she stood on her hotel balcony.
column6: She saw her boyfriend flirting with another girl.
column7: She broke up with him.

column3: My wife sent me a text message.
column4: She was at the supermarket and asked for any requests.
column5: I was away from the phone and did not see the message.
column6: She came home without any treat for me.
column7: I told her I was on a diet anyway.

column3: My coworker Sheila was thin when she started in 1985.
column4: She was attractive and dated several men.
column5: In 1990 she married and left our workplace.
column6: She came by to visit in 1995, 40 pounds heavier.
column7: Her old boyfriends were shocked.

column3: My daughter's college roommate went to a party.
column4: She was drinking on the street.
column5: The police asked her to go inside.
column6: She kept drinking and got arrested.
column7: She spent a night in jail, but charges were dropped.

column3: My wife went to get a pedicure last Saturday.
column4: She was gone for two hours.
column5: She returned without getting a pedicure.
column6: She said the wait was too long, and went shopping instead.
column7: She bought me frappachino, and I was happy.

column3: Our coworker Linda was married.
column4: She was told she could never have children.
column5: She overate to compensate for her sadness.
column6: One day, she got pregnant, and had a normal baby.
column7: She had another one a few years later, and is very happy.

column3: Our new administrative assistant was a large woman.
column4: She weighed over 300 pounds.
column5: Her first day, she went to the restroom.
column6: She came back and said the bowl cracked when she sat on it.
column7: We were supportive and did not laugh at her.

column3: Our cat used to ask for a second feeding at eleven am.
column4: She would tap me to remind me to feed her.
column5: When the hot weather arrived she got very slow.
column6: Today she did not ask for her meal until 4:30.
column7: I think she will change after the heat wave.

column3: My sister in law's husband bought wallpaper for his daughter.
column4: Ten years later, he started hanging it.
column5: He was short by four rolls, and the design was discontinued.
column6: His daughter found some stock on eBay.
column7: He was very relieved.

column3: My sister in law had stomach cramps for years.
column4: The cramps lasted for two minutes, then went away.
column5: She went to several doctors and got confusing diagnoses.
column6: Finally a doctor told her to lose 50 pounds.
column7: She lost 26 pounds and felt better.

column3: My wife paid for a limo service for my birthday.
column4: The driver arrived late, claiming his GPS was wrong.
column5: His car's ac broke down en route to our destination.
column6: He texted during driving.
column7: We complained about the poor service and got a partial refund.

column3: A minivan parked in the middle of the driveway in our building.
column4: The driver loaded some luggage.
column5: He kept the minivan in the driveway.
column6: Another car came behind the minivan and waited.
column7: After the driver beeped, the minivan drove off.

column3: My neighbor Dionne had sugar ants in her apartment.
column4: The exterminator used ant bait.
column5: After a month, she still had ants.
column6: They ended up fumigating her unit.
column7: She is now free of sugar ants.

column3: My friend's daughter is in a custody battle over her son.
column4: The father claims she is bipolar and therefore unfit.
column5: She is on medication and is fighting the case.
column6: In a deposition she admitted restricting visits as revenge.
column7: Her lawyer said this weakens her case.

column3: In 1995 we went to Cape Cod.
column4: The kids collected a lot of seashells.
column5: They smelled up the hotel room.
column6: We tried cleaning them, to no avail.
column7: We threw them out and bought shells from a gift shop.

column3: In 1985 my sister in law repainted her apartment.
column4: The management provided free paint.
column5: She did not like the way her 10 year old son painted.
column6: Her brother in law said the walls needed to cleaned before painting.
column7: She cleaned the walls and got better results.

column3: My friend Bill had a colonoscopy recently.
column4: The next day he had rectal bleeding.
column5: He went to emergency and was admitted.
column6: The doctor had nicked him during the procedure.
column7: He was in the hospital for two nights.

column3: I was looking at Facebook.
column4: The NY Times posted a quiz issued by a bookstore.
column5: It had 50 questions about books and authors.
column6: I took the test, scoring 38 out of 50.
column7: I was disappointed.

column3: I sell things on eBay, Amazon, and Craigslist.
column4: The other day my friend wanted to sell his sea kayak.
column5: His girls had grown up and no longer wanted it.
column6: I sold it on Craigslist for $200.
column7: My friend was pleased to get some money.

column3: When I was in high school I went to my first BSO concert.
column4: The school let people out early to go the concert on Friday.
column5: I went with my friend, a cellist.
column6: The orchestra played Brahms and I was very moved.
column7: I am 63 and still go to the symphony.

column3: I went to Boston Latin School in 1965.
column4: The teachers had an exam school tradition.
column5: You looked to the left and right.
column6: You were told only one of the three would graduate.
column7: All three of my group graduated, luckily.

column3: My remote control started acting odd this morning.
column4: The tv control worked but not the cable.
column5: I got new batteries but that did not solve the problem.
column6: I found out my metal cane interfered with the remote.
column7: I moved the cane away and everything worked.

column3: My daughter and son in law went to a wedding in 2014.
column4: The wedding reception had only vegan appetizers.
column5: No dinners were served.
column6: My son in law does not eat vegetables, and starved.
column7: They had to get subs on the way home from the wedding.

column3: In 1993, a young couple moved into our building.
column4: The woman locked her bike up on a fence.
column5: A week later, she told me the bike had been stolen.
column6: The building took up a collection and paid for a new bike.
column7: She was very moved.

column3: One day, in 1973 I bumped into some Scientologists.
column4: Their center was near my college.
column5: They invited me into the center.
column6: When I got near the lobby I panicked and left.
column7: I have never talked to any Scientologist since that time.

column3: My friend Sally and her husband took their son to Denver.
column4: Their son's futsal team was in a national semifinal.
column5: Futsal is an indoor form of soccer.
column6: The team lost in the semifinal, and everyone had to go home.
column7: Sally and her husband were still very proud.

column3: My daughter wants to buy a big screen tv for her husband.
column4: Their tv has a dark stain on the screen.
column5: We offered to help with the purchase.
column6: She hesitated because the tv is $50 more than she wants to spend.
column7: I told her I would pay the extra money with my mTurk earnings.

column3: My wife went downstairs to mail some letters.
column4: There is a toddler play room near the mailbox.
column5: It was 9:00 at night, and the air conditioner was on.
column6: Since the room was empty, my wife turned off the air conditioner.
column7: It was unlikely children would be using the room so late.

column3: From 2007 to 2008, I read Remembrance of Things Past.
column4: There were seven novels in the series.
column5: It took me several months of reading, as I had to work.
column6: After I read the last book I bought a dozen Madeleines and ate them.
column7: Madelines were featured in the book.

column3: Last year, our building sponsored a cookout.
column4: They had a caterer prepare grilled foods.
column5: We had ribs, hot dogs, chicken, and hamburgers.
column6: They even had an ice cream truck.
column7: We did not eat dinner that day.

column3: My daughter's college friend visited her yesterday.
column4: They went to school in Boston but live in NYC.
column5: The friend brought his six month old to visit.
column6: My daughter's two year old played with the baby.
column7: They posted photos on Facebook.

column3: One day, a neighbor left a box of photos by the dumpster.
column4: They were old studio photos from the 1920s.
column5: I listed some of them on eBay.
column6: I sold most of them for a total of $100.
column7: I check the dumpster often now.

column3: I am not a fan of water.
column4: Today I went out to sit on the bench.
column5: I usually take a bottle of juice.
column6: Bottled water was the only item in the refrigerator, so I took it.
column7: The drink was actually quite refreshing.

column3: My niece took her boyfriend to visit the family on July 4th.
column4: We are from MA and the boyfriend is from Ohio.
column5: We suspected they were going to announce an engagement.
column6: They did not announce any engagement and said he was only visiting.
column7: Everyone was amazed.

column3: Our 2 year old granddaughter lives in NYC.
column4: We are in Boston and do not see her much.
column5: Last week we visited her, walking in through a brown door.
column6: Yesterday our daughter sent a video of our granddaughter.
column7: She was pointing to the door and saying our names.

column3: My sister in law celebrated her 25th wedding anniversary yesterday.
column4: We attended the wedding.
column5: My brother, who is Chinese, taped the ceremony.
column6: My sister in law's work colleagues made racist remarks.
column7: I was outraged when he told me.

column3: My friend George played the cello in high school in 1968.
column4: We belonged to a music appreciation club.
column5: One day we decided to feature George in a concert.
column6: Classical music was not popular, and only a few people came.
column7: George still plays in a local orchestra.

column3: Yesterday we had takeout dinner.
column4: We had just returned from Tanglewood, 120 miles away.
column5: We were very tired.
column6: We ordered subs from a local pizza shop.
column7: I was stuffed after eating only half of a sub.

column3: We got married in 1981.
column4: We honeymooned in Niagara Falls.
column5: There were a lot of international tourists about.
column6: One day, I wore my Mao jacket.
column7: A Chinese man came over a smiled at me, in recognition.

column3: In August of 1991 Hurricane Bob hit the New England area.
column4: We live near a small pond with many trees.
column5: A lot of branches came down.
column6: The young people swam in the pool during the hurricane.
column7: They drank and partied there all night.

column3: My wife's phone was full of photos.
column4: We ran out of space on iCloud.
column5: We did not want to spend money for more storage.
column6: My son was able to back up all the photos onto my desktop.
column7: My wife is now deleting unwanted photos on her phone.

column3: One day I played chess with my friend Max.
column4: We started playing at 11 PM.
column5: The game went on until 1:30 AM.
column6: At one point Max's 2 year old woke up and cried.
column7: After the interruption, I lost the game.

column3: In 2007 our condo had mice.
column4: We used traps and bait.
column5: We killed some mice but more came.
column6: Our property manager sealed every crack with foam.
column7: That kept the mice out for four years.

column3: When I was eight my parents took us to an amusement park.
column4: We went as part of a group from Chinatown.
column5: The local political party rented buses and hung flags.
column6: On the way there, a flag got loose.
column7: My father opened the door and fixed the flag with the bus running.

column3: I worked with Jane and Mikey in 1975.
column4: We worked in a warehouse.
column5: One day Jane and Mikey quit and left Boston, and never came back.
column6: Forty years later, I found Jane on Facebook.
column7: I sent Jane a friend request.

column3: I drove to Starbucks one morning to get coffee.
column4: When I got back to the car I saw it had a flat tire.
column5: I called my 12 year old son at home.
column6: He brought a pump, riding a skateboard.
column7: I was able to fill up the tire enough to drive to a gas station.

column3: I just got the Snapchat App.
column4: Yesterday we went to Tanglewood.
column5: I brought a selfie stick.
column6: I took picture of my wife and myself and put it on Snapchat.
column7: My children were very embarrassed.

column3: Doug was in horrible marriage to Robyn.
column4: Doug filed for divorce because he was unhappy.
column5: Robyn started dating a new man.
column6: Doug got the divorce and went out to celebrate.
column7: Robyn went out with her new boyfriend and he murdered her.

column3: Doug wanted to be with Nelson but he had a problem.
column4: Doug was still married to Robyn who hated his guts.
column5: Doug pleaded with Robyn for a divorce but she said no.
column6: Doug pleaded with Nelson to wait and asked him to be patient.
column7: Doug is now with Nelson because they killed Robyn.

column3: I wondered how an old friend was doing the other day.
column4: I called the number I had for him but it was disconnected.
column5: I called 411 and got a new number for my friend.
column6: I dialed the number and his receptionist answered.
column7: Now I know for sure my old friend is doing just fine.

column3: I heard Samantha Stevens starred on the Twilight Zone show.
column4: I did not believe it and started digging for information.
column5: I binge watched tv episodes of The Twilight Zone Show.
column6: I studied the tv screen very closely.
column7: I learned that Samatha the tv which did star in the Twilight Zone.

column3: I discovered a woman will be running for president.
column4: I researched her background to see where she stands on the issues.
column5: I rather liked her progressive agenda.
column6: I decided I want to vote for a woman for US president.
column7: I registered to vote and I will vote for her in November.

column3: I needed to make some extra money so I searched the internet for jobs.
column4: I discovered I could make money taking surveys on the internet.
column5: I signed up on a website called Tell Me What You Think.
column6: I completed and turned in ten surveys today.
column7: The site paid three dollars and fifty cents.

column3: A boy and his large dog walked towards me earlier today.
column4: I froze in my tracks because I am scared of dogs.
column5: The boy said come on my dog does not bite.
column6: I tried walking pass them but the dog bit me on the leg.
column7: Now I am at the hospital getting 50 rabies shots.

column3: I wondered how merchandising worked.
column4: I immediately researched the topic on the internet.
column5: I learned I needed a story and a product.
column6: I wrote an ebook where my main character sold  Pokemon Go decals.
column7: Now I sell and merchandise my characters decals for mega bucks.

column3: I wanted to be a singer in a band.
column4: I looked online for local singer auditions for bands.
column5: I found a cover band in New York called Galileo that I liked.

column5: She went over to her friends house and they swam together.
column6: Jen decided that she loved the pool and wanted to come over again.
column7: Jen's friend had her over every day that week for the pool!

column3: Janet wanted to get a coke from the vending machine.
column4: She asked friends for money since she didn't have any on her.
column5: When she came to me I gave her a dollar and she used it.
column6: The vending machine ate her money and didn't give her the soda.
column7: She was so upset that she kicked it and the soda fell out!

column3: Ellen decided that she really wanted a new tattoo.
column4: She asked her friends what they thought would be good ideas.
column5: They gave her some joke ideas but none of them appealed to her.
column6: She decided on a tribal tattoo and went to go get it.
column7: When she showed her friends the new tattoo they all loved it!

column3: Jill was very late to class one day.
column4: She begged the teacher to not punish her.
column5: She was always a teacher's pet so the teacher didn't punish her.
column6: Jill was so excited and then she was late the next day.
column7: However, this time, the teacher punished her heavily.

column3: Joanne had a fight with her husband one night.
column4: She called me for comfort but I told her I was busy.
column5: She wasn't very happy so I told her I'd have someone else call her.
column6: I asked my friend to call her and they did.
column7: The next day she told me that my friend was very nice.

column3: Jill really wanted to write a song for her boyfriend.
column4: She compared lyrics from all her favorite bands.
column5: She started to write down lyrics but it didn't seem right.
column6: After days and days of work her song was finished.
column7: Her boyfriend loved it so much!

column3: Nancy was eating dinner with her family.
column4: She didn't enjoy the dinner much but still ate it.
column5: After dinner she went out and bought some chicken instead.
column6: Her family found out and wasn't very happy with her.
column7: Nancy told them that the dinner wasn't good and they understood.

column3: Kate went to the store looking to buy a bathing suit.
column4: She found one she liked and asked for opinions from friends.
column5: They all seemed to like it and so she bought it!
column6: She got home and took the tags off to try it on one more time.
column7: She tried it on and was very disappointed that it didn't fit her.

column3: Laura entered a walking competition.
column4: She had to walk fifteen miles every week, but it was worth it!
column5: On the last day of the week Laura had to walk 10 miles.
column6: She procrastinated so much but finally walked that 10 miles.
column7: Laura went to sleep proud of herself that night.

column3: Jill really wanted to go kayaking.
column4: She invited me to go along with her but I was very nervous.
column5: I asked her what it would entail doing and for instructions.
column6: She calmed me down and explained everything to me.
column7: The next day we went kayaking together!

column3: Jessy wanted to go to a party but none of her friends were going.
column4: She refused to go alone so she kept asking all her friends.
column5: One of them eventually said they'd go with so she picked her up!
column6: They went to the party and all had a great time.
column7: After the party Jessy drove home and thanked her friend a lot.

column3: I asked a girl out a few months ago.
column4: She said yes and I was extremely happy!
column5: We had a lot of fun times and ultimately decided on dating.
column6: Things were kinda rough for awhile but it sorted out.
column7: She ended up becoming my girlfriend and I'm extremely happy for it!

column3: Debbie was running for mayor of her local city!
column4: She setup fliers and handouts for people to see what she was about.
column5: There were several debates with other candidates.
column6: She told me that no matter what she enjoyed herself.
column7: Come election day she actually won and was so excited!

column3: Michelle really wanted to be picked up from school one day.
column4: She usually walks home but didn't want to this time.
column5: Right after school she called her mom and asked to be picked up.
column6: Her mom said she was busy but would do it.
column7: Michelle got picked up about 10 minutes after that and she was happy.

column3: Laura really wanted to go to the zoo.
column4: She was hoping to ride a camel while there, but nothing was certain.
column5: When we finally got to the zoo it was hot and crowded with families.
column6: We walked around for a bit and she got to ride the camel!
column7: When we were leaving the zoo she said she had a great time!

column3: Adri was very nervous to start her day.
column4: She was worried that she was going to fail her test.
column5: She studied as much as she could before school.
column6: When the test started she went very fast through it.
column7: After the test she went home and slept!

column3: Crosby really wanted to throw a party.
column4: She went to the store and bought streamers and lights.
column5: She spent so much money because she really wanted this to be good.
column6: She set everything up and sent the invites.
column7: Eventually Crosby's party was a hit!

column3: Nancy wanted to get a new stereo.
column4: She went to the store and compared options.
column5: She decided on one but chose to compare prices.
column6: Nancy found a better price for her stereo and went to that store.
column7: She purchased her new stereo at a cheaper price and was happy!

column3: Steve felt very nervous preparing for his big date.
column4: The date was a few days ago and with the girl of his dreams!
column5: Steve went to the store for new clothes.
column6: He tried on everything nice and finally bought a shirt!
column7: He wore the shirt to the date and it went great.

column3: Stephen wanted to vote for the next president.
column4: The lines at the voting booth were very busy.
column5: Stephen sat in line waiting for a few hours!
column6: When it was finally his turn to vote, he was very excited.
column7: He finally submitted his vote and then went home.

column3: Scott introduced himself to a local man.
column4: The man asked him what his job was and why he introduced himself.
column5: Scott answered that he was just being friendly.
column6: Scott then proceeded to talk to the man more and more.
column7: They became good friends after all of that.

column3: My brother was set to graduate college so we all went to visit.
column4: The road trip was very long but definitely worth it.
column5: He asked how our trip was and we said it was fine.
column6: The next day we all met up at the stadium where it was being held.
column7: We got lots of pictures of him graduating.

column3: Robert was trying to help his friend with his car troubles.
column4: They diagnosed the issue and looked online for a fix!
column5: Unfortunately they couldn't find anything.
column6: Robert asked his neighbor for some help and he accepted.
column7: His neighbor was able to fix the car and solve his friend's issue.

column3: Duncan sat down with his friend looking for ideas.
column4: They wrote so many different things down trying to find ideas.
column5: Ultimately they were stumped.
column6: Duncan searched the internet and got some new inspiration!
column7: Five minutes later they sat back down and Duncan had the perfect plan!

column3: Me and my friends are all fans of a certain sports team.
column4: This team was on a winning streak, and we were all so happy.
column5: We watched every game together.
column6: When we were watching their most recent game they ended up losing.
column7: We were all very upset, but that was their only loss of the season.

column3: Fred watched the weather every day and trusted it a lot.
column4: Today when Fred watched the weather he told me he didn't believe it.
column5: They said it would rain but it was very sunny.
column6: When it stayed sunny all day Fred was very excited that he was right.
column7: Fred said he couldn't trust the weather anymore.

column3: Nicole was trying to get her driver's license.
column4: Unfortunately she wasn't sure how to drive, so I offered to help!
column5: I took her to the park and had her drive around the grass.
column6: She was doing great and seemed confident enough to take the test.
column7: The next day she took the test and passed!

column3: I had to go to the store one day to buy dog food.
column4: We always buy a certain brand so it was very easy.
column5: Unfortunately they were out of it!
column6: I had to go to a different store 30 minutes away.
column7: When I got to that store I bought the dog food and went home.

column3: My mom wanted a new purse and she drug me along with her.
column4: We arrived at the mall and started looking around.
column5: Eventually she decided on a Coach purse.
column6: We looked in the store and she picked one out.
column7: She ended up buying one and we drove home.

column3: Laura and I decided on going to the beach on Tuesday.
column4: We checked to make sure it was sunny when we woke up.
column5: It was a little cloudy but we decided it should be fine.
column6: We got ready and packed the car with towels!
column7: When we got to the beach it was really sunny and I got burnt!

column3: Laura wanted to go to the mall with me one day.
column4: We didn't know this but it was a holiday, so it was very busy!
column5: She looked around at clothes and we got a burger from a food place.
column6: She asked me if I wanted to look anywhere but I wasn't interested.
column7: On our way home she told me that she bought a few shirts.

column3: A long time ago I had a not-so-serious girlfriend.
column4: We got along fine but we wanted different things in life.
column5: We ended up breaking up after a few months.
column6: I was very upset at first but eventually got over it.
column7: I learned a lot from that relationship and feel better because of it.

column3: My friends and I decided on a movie night for one night.
column4: We got popcorn, movies, and sodas.
column5: We all showed up at my friends house and unloaded all our stuff.
column6: Eventually we secured our spots on the couch and sat down.
column7: We started the movies and everyone had a great time.

column3: Jessica and I volunteered at a local church one year.
column4: We handed out food and set up plates for a barbecue.
column5: When I asked her why she did it she said that she needed the hours.
column6: After it was all over we both volunteered more at other places.
column7: The next year we both volunteered at the same event again!

column3: One day my dogs were running around in the backyard.
column4: We have a small hole in the fence, and they got out!
column5: We searched around the neighborhood and finally found them!
column6: Turns out they didn't make it further than my neighbors house.
column7: He said they were very cute and behaved in his home.

column3: Laura wanted to start going to the gym together.
column4: We looked around and tried to decide which gym we wanted to go to.
column5: I told her that a certain gym was bad and she agreed.
column6: We were about to give up searching but found a nice one close by.
column7: We applied for membership at the nearby gym and now go daily!

column3: My father was diagnosed with cancer.
column4: We spent months taking care of him and driving him to treatment.
column5: He seemed to be getting worse, so we admitted him to a hospital.
column6: The hospital took more scans and tests of his cancerous area.
column7: He was actually cured and released from the hospital cancer free!

column3: Before driving my mom to work I had to get gas for the truck.
column4: We stopped at the gas station but it was full!
column5: I had to wait about 5 minutes to get to a pump.
column6: After getting to a pump I got gas as usual.
column7: My mom was very nervous about being late but it went fine!

column3: Laura and I were on our way out when we decided to go pet shopping.
column4: We went to the humane society first.
column5: We found some very cute puppies that we both wanted.
column6: Unfortunately they were both already adopted so we didn't get any.
column7: The next day we went back and got the cutest puppy ever!

column3: Dennis was always scared of the dentist.
column4: We were always unsure as to why, but he was terrified!
column5: As friends we looked around for another dentist that he could use.
column6: We eventually found a very nice lady dentist.
column7: When Dennis went to this new dentist he was no longer scared!

column3: One time I went fishing with my dad.
column4: We weren't catching anything exciting the whole time.
column5: Suddenly I had a yank on my line!
column6: I was very excited and reeled the fish in.
column7: We went home happy that day.

column3: Alex and I wanted to go to a concert so we bought tickets.
column4: We weren't sure about the time so we showed up very early.
column5: We ended up having to wait hours.
column6: When the concert went out we were both very excited and happy.
column7: At the end of the concert my ears were still ringing from the sound!

column3: I was setting up for a barbecue in my backyard.
column4: We weren't sure if the grill was going to work, so it was stressful.
column5: I got the gas for the grill and attached it.
column6: The grill wouldn't turn on at first but eventually it did.
column7: I started barbecuing the food and all went great!

column3: Me and my girlfriend decided to go on a road trip!
column4: When we were on the road trip we were both very tired.
column5: Since she doesn't drive I was the only one driving.
column6: It ended up being very short because of that.
column7: However, we both enjoyed it a lot.

column3: Sandy went to the beach with her mother on Saturday.
column4: A floating jellyfish stung Sandy while she played in the ocean.
column5: Sandy became scared of going to the beach.
column6: Sandy's mother took her back to the beach on Sunday.
column7: Sandy decided that the beach was fun if there were no jellyfish.

column3: Frank borrowed Jesse's car to run some errands.
column4: Frank got into a collision with another vehicle with Jesse's car.
column5: Jesse thought Frank had been careless.
column6: Frank would not pay for the damage to the car.
column7: Jesse did not let his friends borrow his car anymore.

column3: When Ginny was six, she got a red bicycle.
column4: Ginny couldn't wait to ride it.
column5: On her first ride, she rammed the bike straight into the garage door.
column6: Ginny was so worried that she had damaged her bike.
column7: Luckily, both Ginny and her bike were unscathed from the impact.

column3: Anthony was very shy around women.
column4: He became friends with a pretty girl at work.
column5: Anthony learned that he had a lot in common with her.
column6: He became involved in a brief romance with his female coworker.
column7: From this romance, Anthony gained more confident with women.

column3: Herman bought a vacation home in Florida.
column4: He didn't know the house was built on swampland.
column5: In March, Herman went with his family to stay in the home.
column6: When they arrived they found alligators living in the bathroom.
column7: Herman promptly sued the seller and the real estate agent.

column3: Joey's did not know his driver's license was due for renewal.
column4: The license expired in March.
column5: In July, Joey was pulled over for a burned out tail light.
column6: The policeman wrote him a ticket for driving on an expired license.
column7: In the following years, Joey always remembered to renew his license.

column3: George was an accomplished artist.
column4: He painted a fantastic portrait of Marie.
column5: George gave the painting to Marie as a present.
column6: An art collector offered Marie $15,000 for the painting.
column7: Marie loved the painting too much to sell it.

column3: Larry found a wallet that had $120 in it.
column4: He took the wallet to the police station.
column5: The police looked for the wallet's owner.
column6: The owner of the wallet was extremely happy to get his wallet back.
column7: Larry was surprised to receive a $20 reward from the wallet's owner.

column3: Sally loved to eat baked goods.
column4: Her brother always teased her about getting fat.
column5: Sally was not getting fat.
column6: However, she started to worry whether boys would like her.
column7: Sally started using moderation when eating fatty foods.

column3: Peter wanted to win first prize in the science fair at school.
column4: His sister Greta was a biochemistry major in college.
column5: Greta helped Peter prepare an informative experiment about DNA.
column6: Peter was awarded first prize for his science fair display.
column7: More importantly, Peter learned he wanted to be a geneticist someday.

column3: Jerry wanted to surprise his daughter Kim with a new puppy.
column4: On her birthday, Jerry asked Kim to get him something from the garage.
column5: Kim raised the garage door with remote garage door opener.
column6: A blonde bundle of puppy fur excitedly ran toward Kim from the garage.
column7: This was the best birthday surprise she had ever had.

column3: Jeremy had never tried Mexican food.
column4: One day his friends took him to an authentic Mexican restaurant.
column5: Jeremy decided to try the cheese enchiladas with rice and beans.
column6: He thought his meal was delicious.
column7: Jeremy went back several times afterward to try other entrees.

column3: Tom took up the sport of golf in April.
column4: Soon he became frustrated that his golf score was not improving.
column5: He decided to seek the help of a golf pro from his club.
column6: The pro spent numerous hours with Tom working on fundamentals.
column7: Tom quickly shaved ten points from his handicap.

column3: It was a windy, rainy day as Tia ran errands downtown.
column4: A sudden gust ripped her umbrella out of her hand!
column5: It went sailing off down the street.
column6: Luckily, a kind passerby caught the umbrella and returned it to her.
column7: Tia thanked the Good Samaritan profusely!

column3: Miley had been single for a while.
column4: Against her will, she agreed to go on a blind date her friends set up.
column5: She met her date James at a restaurant for dinner, then a movie.
column6: To her surprise, both people had a great time!
column7: Before parting ways, they planned a second date!

column3: Ella had her plush Bear since birth.
column4: All through childhood, she slept with Bear, patching him as needed.
column5: In her teens she packed him away in her closet lovingly.
column6: But then, packing for college, she rediscovered Bear.
column7: Smiling, she decided to bring Bear with her to college!

column3: It was a very hot and humid day.
column4: Anna couldn't wait to go swimming in her pool after work.
column5: But when she stepped in, she sighed with disappointment.
column6: She had left the pool heater on all day accidentally.
column7: The pool felt like a hot tub - not at all refreshing!

column3: It was low tide along the coast.
column4: Anna went for a walk.
column5: She saw a tide pool and crouched to inspect it.
column6: She saw urchins and starfish, lovely and strange.
column7: Anna was impressed by the aquatic beauty!

column3: Ky had always felt different from other boys.
column4: At age fourteen he realized he was gay.
column5: He was afraid, but he steeled himself and told his family.
column6: Then he came out to his close friends, too.
column7: To his relief, everyone supported Ky!

column3: Peter wanted a snake as a pet.
column4: At first his mom said no way, no how!
column5: She was terrified, but then Peter gave her some books about snakes.
column6: His mom relented when she saw that some snakes were docile and calm.
column7: She allowed Peter to get a ball python snake!

column3: Nina had an essay to write for chemistry.
column4: At first she had no idea what topic to pick.
column5: Then she thought of her best friend Adam, and got inspired.
column6: She wrote a paper on the subject of atoms!
column7: Nina's essay scored an A!

column3: Kim went to the butterfly conservatory with her family.
column4: At first she was nervous.
column5: The fluttering wings unnerved her.
column6: But then one landed on her hand and flapped its delicate wings.
column7: Kim, enchanted, immediately fell in love with the butterflies!

column3: Ava and her brother were playing baseball in the backyard.
column4: Ava's bat smashed the ball - which broke the window next door!
column5: No one saw it happen, but Ava decided she had to do the right thing.
column6: She left a note explaining and apologizing.
column7: Later, the neighbor came over to thank Ava for her honesty.

column3: Anna needed new sneakers for her track team.
column4: But her mom could not afford them for her.
column5: She said Anna would have to buy them out of her own allowance!
column6: Anna determinedly saved her allowance every week.
column7: Soon she had enough for the sneakers she wanted!

column3: Anna wanted to be allowed to wear her makeup.
column4: But her mom said no - fifteen was too young.
column5: She promised that Anna could wear some on her sixteenth birthday.
column6: Anna counted down the days until she turned sixteen.
column7: Then her mom took her shopping for eye shadow and lip gloss!

column3: Anna found a great table at a garage sale.
column4: But one of the legs was wobbly.
column5: It was slightly shorter than the other legs.
column6: Anna was able to secure an inch of wood to even out the legs.
column7: She was proud of her handy craftsmanship!

column3: Nina wanted vines to climb the brick walls of her house.
column4: But she had never even been able to keep a houseplant alive!
column5: She feared the vines would die before they could grow.
column6: Still, she planted them, and to her shock they climbed easily!
column7: Soon her whole brick wall was covered with lush greenery!

column3: Cara and her brother were playing baseball.
column4: But she hit the ball too hard!
column5: It flew over the fence and vanished.
column6: Without a spare, the game was done.
column7: They were forced to quit.

column3: Anna was making Kool-Aid for her kids.
column4: But she ran short on sugar!
column5: She added all she had and hoped for the best.
column6: The kids loved it, to her shock!
column7: Anna had found a healthier way to give her kids drinks!

column3: Leaving the movies one afternoon, Cam and Anna saw a photo booth.
column4: Cam suggested they stop and take a set of photos.
column5: Anna protested, saying she looked bad, but Cam insisted.
column6: The two teens squeezed in and smiled for the photos.
column7: Afterwards, Anna took them home and secretly treasured them!

column3: Irene loved her sister Cammy.
column4: Cammy took ballet and loved it, so Irene asked to sign up too.
column5: But Irene did not like the class at all!
column6: She decided it was okay to be different that Cammy.
column7: Cammy could be the family dancer - not Irene!

column3: A cute new guy came to Anna's junior high school.
column4: Everyone liked him, but he was quiet and aloof.
column5: Nobody dared to approach him, until Anna got up the nerve.
column6: She introduced herself and found out his name was Julian.
column7: Soon, Anna and Julian were making plans for a date that weekend!

column3: Anna and her dad spent a year planning to climb Mount Kilimanjaro.
column4: Finally all was ready, and they flew to Tanzania and hired a guide.
column5: They ascended slowly, acclimating to the thinner air.
column6: Finally they reached the summit, and they gazed out with wonder.
column7: Then they embraced, proud and pleased with each others' success.

column3: Casey had been benched most of the season.
column4: Finally his coach put him in the game.
column5: Casey played very well!
column6: He hit three home runs!
column7: Thanks to his help, his team won the game!

column3: Tom wanted to go to a concert.
column4: He asked his mom for ticket money, but she said he must earn it.
column5: She gave him a list of yard work and chores to do.
column6: He was sad, but Tom diligently did all the work on the list.
column7: Then his mom purchased him a ticket to the concert!

column3: Ben wanted to wear contacts instead of glasses.
column4: He asked his mom if he could try wearing them.
column5: She agreed to get him a trial pair.
column6: At first it was hard to insert them, but Ben persevered.
column7: Soon he could insert them and wear them comfortably all day!

column3: Matty was five and loved scary movies.
column4: He begged his mom to let him stay up late to finish a horror movie.
column5: She warned him he might have nightmares, but finally she gave in.
column6: But sure enough, that night Matty woke screaming from a bad dream!
column7: He sobbingly agreed to listen to his mom's advice from now on.

column3: Evan wanted to quit smoking - he smoked a whole pack a day!
column4: He decided to cut down slowly, one cigarette per day.
column5: He tapered down very, very gradually to minimize withdrawal.
column6: Soon he was almost nicotine-free, and he was so proud.
column7: He kept with his program until he was a non-smoker!

column3: Jim loved to watch wrestling on TV.
column4: He decided to try out for his school's wrestling team.
column5: But the team was nothing like the wrestling he saw on TV!
column6: Jim decided wrestling was not for him after all.
column7: He decided he preferred to just watch it on TV!

column3: Tom was ten and loved doing magic tricks.
column4: He gathered his family for a card trick.
column5: But he fumbled the trick, and it did not work well!
column6: Tom was ashamed, but his family hugged him and encouraged him.
column7: They said practice made perfect and Tom was well on his way there!

column3: Adam was doing poorly in his college English class.
column4: He had been having his roommate Brad write his papers.
column5: But then Brad got sick and had to leave school for over a month!
column6: Adam was forced to study and write on his own.
column7: But luckily, he learned quickly and improved his knowledge!

column3: Joe wanted to join the Army.
column4: He had to take a physical exam.
column5: He was afraid he would not pass.
column6: But after the test, the sergeant congratulated him.
column7: He welcomed Joe into the Army, saying he had passed!

column3: Peter took his dog Rex to the lake one summer afternoon.
column4: He planned to play Frisbee with Rex on the sand.
column5: But Rex had other plans!
column6: He headed right for the water and paddled in to cool off.
column7: Peter laughed as he watched his dog splash and play in the lake.

column3: Frank fell while running.
column4: He put a bandage on his leg.
column5: But it bled through almost at once!
column6: His mom took him to the hospital.
column7: Frank ended up needing twenty-one stitches!

column3: Nino was sixteen and going to a club with his college buddies.
column4: He showed the bounder at the door his fake ID.
column5: But the bouncer scrutinized it, then turned Nino away!
column6: Nino was unable to join his friends inside the nightclub.
column7: Disappointed, he walked home alone.

column3: Tim tried to bake blueberry muffins.
column4: He spooned the batter into cups and put them in the tray.
column5: When the tray was ready, he took it out of the oven.
column6: His muffins smelled delicious.
column7: He tasted them and found they tasted just as yummy!

column3: Kya's doctor said dehydration caused her fatigue and loss of energy.
column4: He told Kya to drink a gallon of water per day.
column5: Kya bought a two-liter Thermos and carried it everywhere.
column6: Every day, she filled it twice, and drank down the water.
column7: It was hard at first, but soon she found she was feeling much better!

column3: Alan's dad bought him a pistol for his eighteenth birthday.
column4: He took Alan to the range so they could learn to shoot.
column5: At first Alan was a very poor shot.
column6: But as he practiced, his aim improved.
column7: Soon Alan a better shot than even his dad!

column3: Evan was bad at science.
column4: He tried his best, but it just made little sense to him.
column5: Still, he studied diligently.
column6: At the end-of-year commencement he was surprised to be called onstage.
column7: There, Evan was given an award for Most Improved Science Student!

column3: John wanted to join his school's weightlifting team.
column4: He tried out, and they let him join even though he was weak.
column5: They told him he had to improve, though, or he'd be let go!
column6: John lifted weights every day at the school gym.
column7: Soon he had improved drastically and was one of the best on the team!

column3: Will went with his friends to a haunted house.
column4: He tried to be brave, but the exhibits scared him!
column5: The ghouls and zombies made him terrified.
column6: Will was glad to leave the house.
column7: He said he'd loved it, but really, he had been fearful the whole time!

column3: Alan went to go play darts at the bar with his friends.
column4: He was a poor shot, missing every throw.
column5: But he kept trying, and soon his aim improved.
column6: He hit the bullseye a few times, even!
column7: By the end of the night, Alan had beat all his friends!

column3: Evan was nine but sometimes still wet the bed.
column4: He was invited to a sleepover but afraid to attend.
column5: He did not want anyone to discover his secret!
column6: Then his mom bought him a pack of absorbent underwear to wear.
column7: Evan felt much more secure with the backup underwear on!

column3: It was Max's first day of kindergarten.
column4: He was nervous to be away from home for the first time.
column5: But he tried to be brave as he entered the classroom.
column6: There, his new teacher was kind and helpful to him all day!
