column6: The speaker reached into a bucket and picked up a human brain.
column7: Elaine decided to major in History.

column3: The College junior was coming home for the summer.
column4: She had not looked for an internship or job during the semester.
column5: She looked forward to spending the summer playing at water sports.
column6: Her parents unhappily discussed the situation with a neighbor.
column7: The neighbor forced her husband to employ the student for the summer.

column3: The moderator decided she would punish the poster for the post.
column4: She waited for weeks before she decided what the punishment would be.
column5: During that time, she gave no indication of her anger over the post.
column6: She waited until the poster was comfortable and posting often.
column7: Without warning, she banned the poster and his IP address.

column3: Janet always wanted to be an EMT.
column4: She was excited to start working with a team of professionals.
column5: She enjoyed helping the people and making them feel more comfortable.
column6: One day she witnessed something that she could never forget.
column7: She decided she could not live with the memories and quit her job.

column3: Laura poured milk on a bowl of cereal.
column4: Some of the cereal had shapes floating on them.
column5: The shapes were bright green or white.
column6: Her husband said there was nothing wrong with her cereal.
column7: Laura made an appointment to see the eye doctor.

column3: The bank was being impossible to deal with for the mortgage.
column4: Sue was at the end of her rope.
column5: She did not think she could get the mortgage to go through in time.
column6: She broke down in tears while talking to her aunt about it.
column7: Her aunt offered to lend her the money and carry the mortgage herself.

column3: The scouts built a huge bonfire in a clearing.
column4: The fire got very hot.
column5: The boys started throwing rocks into the fire.
column6: One of the rocks was slate.
column7: The slate exploded and shards shot from the fire.

column3: The new graduate had a job waiting, but had not yet started work.
column4: The job was in another town and he wanted to buy a house first.
column5: He would be able to make the mortgage payments in the future.
column6: The bank wanted him to be able to make the mortgage payments at once.
column7: He ended up having to throw away money on rent.

column3: One bedroom over the crawl space had an unexplained cord.
column4: The lamp cord went through a drilled hole in the floor.
column5: The man went outside to follow where the cord would lead.
column6: He followed it to the shed in the backyard.
column7: The cord was powering an extension cord in the shed.

column3: The house looked like a good choice for the family.
column4: There were plenty of bedrooms for the five of them.
column5: The house was older but well-maintained.
column6: They only found one thing that they did not like.
column7: There was not a single closet in the entire house.

column3: Finally closing day was here on their dream house.
column4: There were so many inspections and bank questions to get to this date.
column5: The three sellers had arranged for signed paperwork to arrive in time.
column6: It seemed that signing was the only thing left to do.
column7: Sadly, a seller signed the wrong form and closing was rescheduled.

column3: They had few house to look at in their price range.
column4: They finally found one that was in a great location.
column5: It was small but seemingly under-priced for the area.
column6: When they walked through the house, they understood the pricing.
column7: The floor in the center of the house sagged badly to the middle.

column3: The mother decided she would take her children to the park.
column4: They participated in a program about sea turtles.
column5: At night they gathered for a talk about the turtles.
column6: The ranger got a call about a turtle on the beach.
column7: They all raced together to watch the turtle lay eggs on the beach.

column3: The family fondly remembered the restaurant shaped like a spaceship.
column4: When they visited the area again, they wanted to eat there.
column5: They took what they thought was the right exit for the restaurant.
column6: They were disappointed to find that the restaurant was gone.
column7: In the place of the cool restaurant was an industrial park.

column3: Little Billy had a crush on a cute girl in his class.
column4: Billy decided to ask the girl out on a date.
column5: The girl told Billy that she wouldn't date him because he had cooties.
column6: The next day Billy sat on his front porch thinking about relationships.
column7: Billy decided that he would never ask a girl out ever again.

column3: Tyler was a lonely man who desperately wanted to get married.
column4: He created a dating profile online, complete with pictures and a bio.
column5: He went on many dates with girls, but only one stuck out to him.
column6: After dating that special girl for 2 years, he asked her to marry him.
column7: They are now happily married and Tyler is no longer lonely.

column3: A man named Tim wanted to learn meditation.
column4: Tim bought a plane ticket to the Himalayan Mountains.
column5: A week later Tim took a trip to the Himalayan Mountains,
column6: While there, Tim met an expert monk who taught him meditation.
column7: Tim now spends most of his days meditating.

column3: Ian was excited because his favorite band was coming to his town.
column4: He asked a girl he liked to go to the concert with him and she agreed.
column5: He borrowed some money from his brother to buy the tickets.
column6: The night before the concert, he could barely sleep.
column7: Finally the day came and Ian had an incredible time!

column3: Patrick was very excited about the new racing videogame coming out.
column4: He bought it on the first day of its release.
column5: But he discovered his PC couldn't handle the game's advanced graphics.
column6: He decided to splurge on a new graphics card.
column7: After he installed the new card, the game played beautifully.

column3: Davis always loved model train sets.
column4: He decided to set up a model train set in his basement.
column5: He asked his son to join him in the effort.
column6: They spent weeks putting it together in intricate detail.
column7: They were both very proud when the elaborate set-up was all done.

column3: Mark decided he wanted to surprise his son with a cool gift.
column4: He drew up plans for an excellent tree house to build in the backyard.
column5: Mark got some friends together to build it all in one day.
column6: When Mark's son got home from school, Mark showed him the gift.
column7: The boy was incredibly surprised and thrilled at the amazing present.

column3: Phil was feeling very lethargic lately and it was getting him down.
column4: He wanted to start an exercise regimen but his schedule was full.
column5: His friend, a fitness expert, offered a good suggestion.
column6: She recommended he start bicycling to work every day and Phil agreed.
column7: After a few weeks of his new habit, he already felt a lot better.

column3: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
column4: He was against them instituting permit parking on his street.
column5: He organized a petition and collected numerous signatures.
column6: He also spoke at several city council meetings.
column7: Thankfully, he was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.

column3: Steve got home late from work and pulled into his parking lot.
column4: He was annoyed to see there was a car parked in his reserved spot.
column5: He left a note on the car and went to find street parking.
column6: The next morning, there was a note taped to Steve's front door.
column7: It was from a new neighbor, who apologized profusely for the mistake.

column3: Karen was worried about her daughter Sue's diet.
column4: It seemed as if Sue was becoming dangerously thin.
column5: Karen began to suspect that Sue was anorexic.
column6: Karen took Sue to an eating disorder specialist.
column7: The treatment was effective and soon Sue was eating normally.

column3: Bryce wanted to compete in the Baja races at the county fair.
column4: He spent weeks fine tuning his car in preparation.
column5: The day of the races he won his first race.
column6: Then everything began to go wrong including two flat tires!
column7: He ended the night in dead last with a broken car and a broken hand.

column3: Anne was overwhelmed at worked.
column4: Her boss yelled at her for everything.
column5: One day Anne was offered a new job.
column6: She accepted it.
column7: Anne made the right decision to move on.

column3: I was first on the leaderboard in a game I was playing.
column4: A competitor was trying to oust me from my first place spot.
column5: We competed furiously in the game, each trying to outdo the other.
column6: Eventually, I was unable to maintain my first spot.
column7: He got 1 more point than I did, and claimed the first spot.

column3: The Smiths lived near a national forest.
column4: A forest fire started near them and was approaching their house.
column5: They were told by the fire department that they had to evacuate.
column6: They gathered whatever belongings they could and drove to a motel.
column7: They felt fortunate when they heard that their house was unharmed.

column3: I was getting married in a 2 weeks' time.
column4: A friend of mine had arranged a bridal shower for me.
column5: She had prepared all the food and invitations.
column6: We played lots of games and I had a great time.
column7: I received a lot of presents as well.

column3: I decided to invest my money to have enough for retirement.
column4: After careful consideration, I bought a few stocks.
column5: My research also showed that I should invest in bonds.
column6: I put what was left in a savings account.
column7: As far as I can tell, that was a good way to invest my money.

column3: The kitchen faucet had started to leak.
column4: Although it was fairly new, it was of poor quality.
column5: I decided to buy a better-quality faucet through mail-order.
column6: When my new faucet arrived, I replaced the old one with it.
column7: My faucet doesn't leak any more.

column3: My mother had bought me a pair of new shoes.
column4: As I put them on my feet, my dog came over to lick them.
column5: I thought that my dog's feet might be cold.
column6: I took my shoes off and put them on my dog.
column7: Now I need another pair of new shoes.

column3: I was riding my bicycle near downhill near my house.
column4: As I was confident of my abilities, I rode very fast.
column5: A squirrel can in front of me, and I swerved to avoid it.
column6: I fell off my bicycle and slammed onto the ground.
column7: Fortunately, I was wearing my helmet and was unhurt.

column3: Tom had read about a website where he could meet women for a date.
column4: Even though he was married, he decided to give it a try.
column5: It cost $40 to sign up.
column6: He entered his credit card number and particulars into the website.
column7: He never heard back from them after that.

column3: I had been practicing hard for the soccer game.
column4: Even though I was ill, I wanted to play in the game.
column5: The coach told me to stay home and rest.
column6: I was upset because I had been practicing for months.
column7: The coach told me I could resume playing after I was well.

column3: I wanted to go on a cruise as I had never been on one before.
column4: For 2 years, I saved money every month from my paychecks.
column5: I went online to purchase a ticket for the cruise.
column6: The prices had increased dramatically compared to 2 years ago.
column7: I wasn't able to afford the trip, so I bought myself a tv instead.

column3: I was taking an art class with my friend.
column4: For our test, we had to each paint an apple.
column5: I had procrastinated until the night before it was due.
column6: My friend had been working on her painting all week.
column7: I was pleased that my picture turned out better than my friend's.

column3: During my recent visit, my dentist told me that I had no new cavities.
column4: For the past year, I had been diligent in brushing my teeth.
column5: I had also started a daily regimen of flossing twice a day.
column6: This all paid off.
column7: After this, I plan to also start using an oral rinse every day.

column3: My neighbor was illiterate.
column4: He asked me to teach him how to read.
column5: I started by teaching him the alphabet and spelling.
column6: He went on to read children's stories and nursery rhymes.
column7: Now, he proudly reads newspapers and magazines.

column3: I yelled at a telemarketer yesterday.
column4: He wanted to sign me up for a new credit card.
column5: He said I could use it to pay for a fancy vacation.
column6: I got really mad because he told me to be irresponsible.
column7: I hung up the phone on him.

column3: Tom ate a lot and got fatter and fatter.
column4: I asked him why he ate so much.
column5: He said it was because his wife, Mary, kept buying food.
column6: I asked Mary why she bought so much food.
column7: She said it was because Tom kept eating the food.

column3: I think it's important to dress well and impress people.
column4: I bought an expensive car and married an expensive wife.
column5: Many people wanted to do business with me due to my successful image.
column6: Being a shrewd businessman, I turned my name into an icon.
column7: Now, people pay me millions just to use my name on their buildings.

column3: My doctor told me that I was obese and needed to lose weight.
column4: I decided to go on a strict diet.
column5: I did not allow myself to eat sugar in any form.
column6: I ate mainly broccoli, kale and water.
column7: Although I lost weight, I felt miserable and angry.

column3: I was taking an exam.
column4: I felt confident since I had been studying for it for a week.
column5: When I got my exam back, I found I had scored 80%.
column6: My friend, who only studied for one day, scored 90%.
column7: I was mad since she did better than I did even though I studied more.

column3: I decided to bake a cake for my friend's birthday.
column4: I had a recipe, but decided not to follow it.
column5: Even though the cake turned out badly, I gave it to my friend.
column6: To my surprise, she was very happy with the cake.
column7: She told me that it's the thought that counts.

column3: After I got off from work, I went to vote at my assigned location.
column4: I had already registered to vote a month ago.
column5: I got to the front of the line, and was told I could not vote.
column6: Apparently, someone had altered my party affiliation.
column7: I left the voting location, confused and upset.

column3: After a semester of hard work, I finally got an A in my math class.
column4: I had attended every lecture, no matter how boring it was.
column5: I did every homework assignment, even the difficult ones.
column6: Although I wanted to quit, I persevered through the class.
column7: I'm proud of my grade.

column3: I finally paid off my credit card.
column4: I had been paying on it for months.
column5: A year ago, I had used it to pay for an online class.
column6: I almost paid it off, then I used it to pay for a vacation.
column7: Finally, both the class and the vacation are all paid off.

column3: I am having trouble finding steady employment.
column4: I had been sent to fight the war in Iraq for almost a year.
column5: My job there was to load the ammunition into the artillery.
column6: I watched several of my comrades die there.
column7: Although I am glad to be home now, I can't make ends meet.

column3: I am supposed to take food to a party tomorrow.
column4: I had bought all the ingredients for it last week.
column5: I spent all day yesterday cooking the food.
column6: Unfortunately, I burnt the food.
column7: I won't be able to get new ingredients in time for tomorrow's party.

column3: My friend was flying over to visit me.
column4: I had made plans to pick her up at the airport at 5pm.
column5: When I got there, she said she had been waiting for me for an hour.
column6: Apparently her plane had landed at 4pm.
column7: We had forgotten to match up our time zones.

column3: I just harvested some carrots from my garden.
column4: I had planted carrot seeds and melon seeds months ago.
column5: The carrots are ready to eat, but the melon seeds never grew.
column6: Maybe I need to wait a few more months for the melons to grow.
column7: I am looking forward to eating melons.

column3: I was allowed to use my calculator for my math test.
column4: I had spent all week practicing using it for my homework.
column5: I was confident that I would do well on the test.
column6: During the test, my calculator ran out of battery.
column7: I couldn't answer the questions, and ending up failing.

column3: My foot has been itching badly since I got that mosquito bite.
column4: I have been scratching the bite all day long since I got it.
column5: The mosquito bit me on the bottom of my foot.
column6: The ointment I put on it didn't really help much.
column7: Tomorrow, I'll try putting a hot towel on it to decrease the swelling.

column3: I heard from my neighbor that there was a bear in the neighborhood.
column4: I haven't been jogging for days because I'm afraid of the bear.
column5: The bear was last sighted 2 weeks ago near my house.
column6: I should wait at least another month before I go jogging again.
column7: Meanwhile, I do yoga instead.

column3: My friend had an apple tree.
column4: I helped her to pick the apples to make apple pies.
column5: She misread the instructions and used the wrong amount of butter.
column6: She was only supposed to use 2 tablespoons, but she had used 2 cups.
column7: The apple pie ended up being too moist, and the shell wouldn't hold.

column3: I read about a really great investment and decided to take advantage.
column4: I invested $10,000 with the company.
column5: A couple of months later, I read that it was a Ponzi scheme.
column6: I lost all the money I had invested in it.
column7: The person running the company went to prison.

column3: My friend was running for the presidency.
column4: I joined her campaign as I badly wanted her to win the election.
column5: I devised a plan to oust her opponent, and emailed it to her.
column6: Unfortunately, my emails were intercepted and leaked.
column7: I apologized to her opponent and stepped down from her campaign.

column3: I couldn't find my lunch box.
column4: I looked through my bag, my car and my kitchen.
column5: When I went to work, I saw my lunch box in the trash.
column6: I must have left it in the refrigerator at work last week.
column7: The secretary must have cleaned out the refrigerator over the weekend.

column3: I had a pretty party dress that I wanted to wear to class.
column4: I put it on, together with fancy shoes and some fake pearls.
column5: Thinking that I looked spectacular, I proudly walked into class.
column6: The whole class started to laugh.
column7: Apparently, it is unacceptable to wear a party dress to class.

column3: When I was a child, I believed I could fly as well as Superman.
column4: I put on a cape and got my father's ladder from the garage.
column5: I climbed onto the roof and jumped off.
column6: I ended up breaking my leg and had a cast for 4 weeks.
column7: I no longer believe I can fly as well as Superman.

column3: I heard a strange noise outside my window.
column4: I remember hearing that same noise a year ago.
column5: I went outside to investigate.
column6: There were two deer in my yard, mating.
column7: They were the ones who were making that noise.

column3: I am very good at branding my name.
column4: I started out with only $50 million when I was 20 years old.
column5: Now I have amassed $10 billion through selling my brand.
column6: I put my brand name on buildings, water and steaks.
column7: I even have my own brand of clothing, but I don't wear it myself.

column3: When I was out for a jog, I saw a duck wandering along the road.
column4: I tried to pick it up, but it ran away from me.
column5: I later overheard my neighbor lamenting about his lost duck.
column6: When I went over to tell him about the duck, he was overjoyed.
column7: I showed him where I had seen the duck, but it was no longer there.

column3: I've lost my photo album.
column4: I used to look through the photos in the album frequently.
column5: I miss those photos.
column6: I made a collage out of a few photos a couple of years ago.
column7: That's all I have left of the photo album.

column3: It took me 4 years to get my degree in chemical engineering.
column4: I was able to land a well-paying job in the petroleum industry.
column5: This was before OPEC announced that they would not lower production.
column6: After their announcement, oil prices started to decline.
column7: My employer could no longer justify keeping me, so I lost my job.

column3: It was my first day at school in 10 years.
column4: I was very nervous but decided to sit in the front row anyway.
column5: To my surprise, the class was very interesting and engaging.
column6: I even made a few friends in class that day.
column7: I wish I had gone back to school earlier.

column3: My neighbor likes to play his music too loudly.
column4: I went over to his apartment and knocked on his door.
column5: When he opened the door, I told him to turn his music down.
column6: Because his music was so loud, he couldn't hear what I was saying.
column7: I had to write it down on a piece of paper and show it to him.

column3: My back had been hurting for over a month.
column4: I went to the doctor and he examined me.
column5: I told him about how I had lifted a heavy box 2 months ago.
column6: He said that's probably why my back hurts now.
column7: I'm not going to lift any more heavy boxes.

column3: There was a bad smelling coming from the kitchen.
column4: I went to the kitchen to investigate.
column5: The smell seemed to be coming from behind the oven.
column6: After I pushed the oven out, I could see what caused the smell.
column7: A rat had died behind the oven.

column3: For art class, I had to make a painting of a pineapple.
column4: I went to the store, and bought a nice green pineapple.
column5: I started my painting as soon as I got home.
column6: It took me 2 weeks to finish the painting.
column7: By then, the pineapple had yellowed and parts were rotten.

column3: Initially, I thought I was looking at a bird with no head.
column4: It had only a body and legs, and was standing in a pool of water.
column5: It ignored all the fish that were swimming around it.
column6: Then the bird's head peeked out from under its wing.
column7: It had been sleeping with its head tucked under its wing.

column3: I was browsing the internet when a pop-up screen appeared.
column4: It said I had a virus on my computer and gave me a number to call.
column5: Worried that I had a virus, I immediately called the number.
column6: The person who answered demanded $100 to solve my problem.
column7: He got rid of the virus after I paid with my credit card.

column3: I had heard about a great new haircutting product called Flowbee.
column4: It sounded really efficient and clean.
column5: I bought one and used it to cut my own hair.
column6: When I told my pals that I had cut my own hair, they were impressed.
column7: Now they all want me to cut their hair with the Flowbee.

column3: I ride my bicycle to school every day.
column4: It's different when I ride it in Spring, though.
column5: In spring, all the plants along the side of the road bloom.
column6: In particular, one plant had thorns which pricked my tires.
column7: I ended up with two flat tires that day.

column3: I was going to a job interview at a prestigious law firm.
column4: Most people prepare by practicing in front of the mirror, as did I.
column5: I had a set of questions and answers that I rehearsed over and over.
column6: Unfortunately, I wasn't asked any of the questions I had prepared.
column7: As a result, I did very poorly at the interview.

column3: I wore a collared shirt and a pair of jeans to work one day.
column4: My boss called me into his office and told me to dress better.
column5: Anxious about keeping my job, I nodded my head and agreed.
column6: At that moment, the CEO walked in, dressed in a t-shirt and shorts.
column7: My boss laughed and told me to forget it.

column3: I bought a sewing machine because I wanted to learn how to sew.
column4: My first project was to make a simple bag.
column5: It turned out really well.
column6: I've made many projects over the years.
column7: The best project was a party dress that I made out of satin last year.

column3: When I was a child, I went to the lake with my brothers.
column4: My older brother was able to walk along the bottom of the lake.
column5: My little brother said the lake was too deep and refused to enter.
column6: The bottom of the lake was too deep for me to walk along.
column7: I did, however, manage to swim across the lake.

column3: There was going to be a dance at school.
column4: Nervously, I asked Mary to go to the dance with me.
column5: I was delighted when she accepted!
column6: I practiced dancing in front of the mirror for a week.
column7: Unfortunately, the dance was canceled due to an epidemic.

column3: I wanted to plant a new cherry tree in my backyard.
column4: Rather than pay for someone to do the digging, I dug the hole myself.
column5: As I dug deeper, I suddenly felt my shovel hit a hard object.
column6: I thought it was a rock, but it turned out to be a pipe.
column7: I had burst the pipe and ended up with a costly repair bill.

column3: I met a smart, beautiful and intriguing young woman at the library.
column4: She was wearing the most exquisite and sensuous perfume.
column5: I can't get her and the scent out of my head.
column6: Yesterday, to my delight, I smelled the scent again.
column7: Unfortunately, it was at the mall, and someone had sprayed it at me.

column3: The presidential candidate was giving a speech at the podium.
column4: Suddenly, the crowd started pointing and laughing.
column5: Confused, the candidate looked around for the source of the laughter.
column6: He noticed that the crowd was pointing to a bird hopping on the stage.
column7: The bird flew up to the podium, causing the crowd to cheer.

column3: I went ice skating with my friends.
column4: That was the first time I had ever been skating.
column5: My friends, on the other hand, were experienced skaters.
column6: They were teaching me to do a spin when I fell and hurt my wrist.
column7: I went to a doctor, who told me my wrist was sprained.

column3: I was waiting in line to vote at the voting booth.
column4: The clerk came to tell me that they were out of ballots.
column5: I asked her when new ballots would arrive, as I wanted to vote.
column6: Since she said it could take hours, I decided to go home.
column7: I didn't vote during that election.

column3: Last month, I received an email message on my work account.
column4: The email said to click on the enclosed link for an update.
column5: I clicked it and a file started to download onto my computer.
column6: Then I was suddenly locked out of my computer.
column7: I was helpless as my files were stolen in the phishing scam.

column3: I had a job picking cherries during the summer.
column4: The job was much tougher than I thought it would be.
column5: I had to climb up and down the ladder while carrying bags of cherries.
column6: Eventually, I made only about $5 an hour since I was so slow.
column7: The only thing I liked about it were the free cherries I received.

column3: I was watching tv at home.
column4: The kids were playing football in the house.
column5: I told them to stop playing in the house, but they wouldn't listen.
column6: They threw the football at the tv and broke it.
column7: I grounded them for a month.

column3: I frequently go jogging near my house.
column4: The past few times I have been jogging, wasps have been following me.
column5: During one of those times, a wasp landed on my face.
column6: Startled, I slapped at it and it stung me.
column7: I still go jogging along that route, but haven't been stung again.

column3: In an effort to lose weight, I tried an exercise program.
column4: The program started with my walking for half an hour daily.
column5: I kept up the routine for a week.
column6: Once the week was up, I started jogging for half an hour daily.
column7: So far, I have lost 10 pounds by sticking to the program.

column3: I work as a secretary.
column4: There was a bin in the office that was full of paper.
column5: My boss told me to call maintenance to get rid of it.
column6: I called maintenance, but they said it was too heavy to move.
column7: I had to remove half of the paper so that they could move it.

column3: I went to the Lost and Found department to see if they had my bag.
column4: They asked me for a description of my bag.
column5: I told them what it looked like, but they didn't have it there.
column6: Then I found my bag at my friend's house.
column7: I must have left it there last week and forgotten.

column3: As I was driving to work, it started to rain.
column4: This made me mad because I had just washed my car the day before.
column5: The was a pothole full of mud in the middle of the road.
column6: I couldn't help but drive over it, making my car dirty again.
column7: I was even madder now, because I had to wash my car again.

column3: I was appointed Chairman of the company.
column4: To make a good impression, I redecorated my office.
