column7: It was a fun annual tradition!

column3: The gym class always played interesting games.
column4: They decided to try badminton.
column5: They hit the birdie over the next, back and forth.
column6: Soon, they were all very good at the game.
column7: The games got very competitive and fun.

column3: Two teams were playing for the championship.
column4: They each scored 50 points in the first half.
column5: The second half, the blue team pulled away.
column6: They won the game by 17 points.
column7: The blue team was so proud!

column3: The team was psyched for the big game on Saturday.
column4: They had been practicing for months and wanted to win the title.
column5: The game was intense, with both teams scoring a lot.
column6: The team worked as hard as they could, but they just couldn't win the.
column7: After the game, the players all cried.

column3: The Millers were shopping.
column4: They had bought a new home and needed to furnish it.
column5: The last item on their list was the tv.
column6: They went to several electronics stores.
column7: Finally, they got a great deal on a 50 inch tv.

column3: Drew was ready for a night out with his family.
column4: They had tickets to the circus.
column5: The kids were so excited to go.
column6: They all loved the clowns and elephants.
column7: After it was over, they all clapped and cheered.

column3: The boys loved playing outside.
column4: They had walkie talkies that the used to talk to each other.
column5: They would run through the woods and keep in contact with them.
column6: They played this game all summer.
column7: THey couldn't wait until next summer to play it again!

column3: Fran liked to think about her boyfriend.
column4: They hadn't seen each other in a year and missed each other.
column5: Fran had a lot of good memories.
column6: They would be reunited soon.
column7: She daydreamed about him until she saw him again.

column3: Max and Calvin were best friends that did everything together.
column4: They loved to play Minecraft on their Xbox.
column5: They would play for hours on end.
column6: After they built a great new world, they saved their progress.
column7: The were anxious to play together again.

column3: The concrete workers had been working all day.
column4: They redid the sidewalk in front of Ava's house.
column5: The smoothed it out perfectly.
column6: Then, a little girl came running by.
column7: She left a footprint in the perfectly smooth sidewalk.

column3: Ashley loved going out with her friends and having a drink.
column4: They tried a new martini place.
column5: The atmosphere was great and the martini was wonderful.
column6: Ashley had a fun time spending time with her friends.
column7: They decided that they would come back to that bar more often.

column3: The family wanted to take a walk.
column4: They went around the lagoon on a path they'd never been on.
column5: They were taken to a remote spot they'd never seen before.
column6: It was a beautiful location with lots of trees and water.
column7: The family decided to come walk here every evening.

column3: The class went on a field trip.
column4: They went to a local farm to learn about raising animals.
column5: The kids fed some chickens and collected eggs.
column6: At the end of the trip, they had learned a lot.
column7: The kids now understood where their food had come from.

column3: Kim and Dave were having marriage troubles.
column4: They went to see a therapist.
column5: They tried to talk out all their problems.
column6: Their communication skills improved.
column7: Soon, they were happy again.

column3: Jennifer was worried about her kids.
column4: They were at the pool and had forgotten their sunscreen.
column5: When they came home, their skin was all red.
column6: Jennifer put aloe on them and warned them not to do that again.
column7: They promised they would be more responsible.

column3: Hannah invited her friends over.
column4: They were going to have one more sleepover before the summer ended.
column5: They all brought snacks and games.
column6: The next morning, they were exhausted.
column7: They had stayed up all night.

column3: The friends all liked to invent new recipes.
column4: They were mixing and matching candy in their s'mores.
column5: Andrea used Reece's and decided it was the best.
column6: Her friends all agreed.
column7: They all started making their smores with Reese's too.

column3: The birds were ready to leave the nest.
column4: They'd been hatched about a month.
column5: They flapped their wings and jumped.
column6: They all took off and learned to fly.
column7: They flew off and made their own nests.

column3: Doctor Jones was nervous about Tom's upcoming surgery.
column4: Tom had a very rare disorder and needed some help breathing.
column5: Tom had prepared for months for the surgery.
column6: He was physically healthy but very nervous mentally.
column7: Doctor Jones reassured him that it would be ok.

column3: Courtney loved going to the waterpark.
column4: Water slides were her favorite thing to do!
column5: She went down each slide a dozen times.
column6: When she was tired, she sat down and had a popsicle.
column7: Once she was rested, she was ready to slide again!

column3: My brother bought a pet snake.
column4: He forgot to put the lid on its cage and it escaped!
column5: He looked all over the house and could not find it.
column6: Today, when he was watching TV, he saw it slither across the screen.
column7: He grabbed the snake and put it back in its cage.

column3: Mike asked me on a date.
column4: He told me to meet him at Starbucks and gave me the address.
column5: When I arrived, he was nowhere to be found!
column6: Mike had given me the wrong address.
column7: I did not go on another date with Mike.

column3: Adam went to swim class every day after school.
column4: He was afraid to put his head under the water.
column5: The teacher told him not to be afraid because he would float.
column6: One day, his best friend threw him into the pool!
column7: Adam remembered the swimming lesson and floated safely to the surface.

column3: Liz needed to get into her freezer to get out the chicken for dinner.
column4: She pulled hard on the freezer door, but it was frozen shut.
column5: Suddenly it opened with a loud BANG and she fell to the floor in pain.
column6: The chicken had fallen out and broken her foot!
column7: Liz had ice cream for dinner at the hospital instead.

column3: Austin and Leah went to the Brazilian Steakhouse for dinner.
column4: The waiters brought different cuts of steak to their table.
column5: Leah tasted the rare steak and gagged.
column6: There was so much pink blood all over the steak!
column7: The chef cooked a piece of well done steak just for her.

column3: Don and his son James rented a cabin in the woods for their vacation.
column4: They arrived at the cabin late at night and crawled into bed.
column5: James started to scream that he saw a hand through the window!
column6: Don went outside to investigate the mysterious hand.
column7: There was nothing outside of the window but branches.

column3: My parents went to Disney World last month.
column4: They ride Space Mountain twenty times!
column5: Being tossed around in the ride made my dad sick.
column6: He felt so bad that they decided to come home early.
column7: Next time they visit Disney, he won't ride Space Mountain.

column3: My dad took me to the Orioles baseball game tonight.
column4: We sat in the very front row.
column5: During the first inning, my dad jumped up and caught Davis's home run!
column6: Dad held up the ball and was put on the jumbotron!
column7: Everyone around me cheered for my dad's big catch.

column3: Tim and Tom stayed at the Roach Motel in New York City.
column4: When they got home, Tim started itching and Tom was covered in welts.
column5: Tim searched their house to find the source of the itching.
column6: The suitcases they took to New York were full of bedbugs!
column7: Tim called the exterminator while Tom called the lawyer.

column3: James was having trouble sleeping again.
column4: The night before he had been up all night studying for finals.
column5: He was tossing and turning in bed, worried and unable to sleep.
column6: Unable to fall asleep, his mind raced and his body ached for rest.
column7: James fell asleep around dawn,missing his test but getting good sleep.

column3: Stacy, Andy, and Drew were playing in the basement.
column4: Andy thought it would be funny to cover Stacy with a beanbag.
column5: He sat on top of it, unaware that Stacy could not breath.
column6: Drew saw, and ran upstairs to tell his parents about the danger.
column7: It was quite the scare for Stacy, and Andy quickly apologized.

column3: One time I ran a three kilometer race.
column4: Before it began I had eaten some food for energy.
column5: I picked a steady pace at which I felt comfortable.
column6: Near the end I sped up to beat another runner.
column7: I tied with him and threw up my food, regretting it badly.

column3: I went on a hike one morning by myself to have some time alone.
column4: I brought along a lighter, planning to make a fire to stay warm.
column5: I gathered grass and wood together into a pile.
column6: I struggled to light it for half an hour.
column7: I gave up and got a torch, realizing my woodsman skills are lacking.

column3: I decided to go for a hike one day.
column4: I found a trail in the woods which went for many miles.
column5: I had not been hiking recently, and did not take that into account.
column6: I hiked until I was tired, forgetting I had to walk back.
column7: I had forgotten water too, and struggled all the way home.

column3: My small school group went on a backpacking trip.
column4: I thought that If I carried less food weight, that I would eat less.
column5: Seven miles up the trail, my small bag of trail mix was unsatisfying.
column6: I spent the rest of the week extremely hungry.
column7: I learned my lesson and always brought plenty of food on later trips.

column3: My friends and I were having a friendly game of soccer.
column4: Richard was the goalie, and I was on my way towards him.
column5: I kicked the ball towards the net with great confidence.
column6: Richard stopped the ball with his arm, but felt a sudden pain.
column7: Unfortunately he broke his arm, but it healed well in the next month.

column3: A group of friends went on a snowmobile ride one afternoon.
column4: The rider in front of me was moving up a slope at an angle.
column5: She decided to stop giving it gas and, promptly began to roll sideways.
column6: She jumped off the sled and ran away from it, almost being crushed.
column7: She managed to safely get away and we laughed about it later.

column3: Jerry and Andrew decided to build a treehouse to hang out in.
column4: They gathered the materials but could not agree which tree was best.
column5: They argued about it and hurt each other's feelings.
column6: After they had thought about it, they apologized to each other.
column7: They decided friendship was more important than getting their own way.

column3: I was staying with my grandparents for a weekend.
column4: They told me to finish getting dressed so we could leave.
column5: I refused to put my pants on so she put me in the car with no pants.
column6: I was beginning to fear I would have to walk around in my underwear.
column7: Right before we left they gave them to me and I learned my lesson.

column3: My family and I ordered pizza one day for lunch.
column4: We were anxiously awaiting it's cheesy flavor as we prepared.
column5: When our backs were turned our cat jumped onto the table.
column6: She began to lick the cheese off the pizza, ruining our delicious meal.
column7: I could not believe my eyes and we thoroughly scolded the cat.

column3: My family's old barn collapsed one night.
column4: We were out working one day cleaning it up.
column5: There was a large section of board covered in rusty nails.
column6: Someone stepped onto the boards and got stabbed by the nails.
column7: We had to take them to get a tetanus shot right away.

column3: I was in Peru on a mission trip.
column4: When we arrived at the house, there were many fruit trees.
column5: I could not believe my eyes when i saw a star fruit tree.
column6: My friends and I picked as many as we could eat.
column7: There is nothing better than a star fruit right off the tree.

column3: One day at the zoo, I walked over to the gorilla enclosure.
column4: A large male silverback gorilla walked out from the corner.
column5: He sat in the center of the viewing area, as if posing.
column6: He glared angrily at me the entire time I was there.
column7: I felt very guilty, like I shouldn't be there looking at him.

column3: Pink the Pink Gin was obtained through an evening of play.
column4: Caleb wanted to use a special claw machine, one that was known to work.
column5: He tried only one time to reach the square pink penguin.
column6: He grabbed it with the claw, and squealed with excitement.
column7: He took it home with him that night, happy he had won a prize.

column3: I recently lost a lot of weight.
column4: Despite this, my feet and legs remained swollen from edema.
column5: Every day, I had to put on a pair of compression socks.
column6: The socks helped bring the swelling down all day.
column7: At the end of the day, my legs weren't as swollen as they used to be.

column3: I lost a lot of weight using healthy eating habits.
column4: Every day, I ate 5 to 9 servings of fruits and vegetables.
column5: I piled things like broccoli up on my plate while ignoring fats.
column6: Eventually, I lost 80 pounds of fat and water.
column7: The accumulated fluids left my body in only a few months.

column3: We had a huge fight this morning over the coffee.
column4: Every time I make it, Mack says I'm doing it wrong.
column5: He tells me I cook the water too long once the coffee drips in.
column6: I think it tastes better with the slightly roasted flavor.
column7: He refused to drink any of it, so I ended up drinking the entire pot.

column3: I dyed my black hair with pink temporary coloring.
column4: First I bleached a large portion of my hair.
column5: Then I applied organic bright pink vegetable dye.
column6: I washed it out in the bathtub, leaving a pink ring.
column7: The dye will last about 6 weeks.

column3: The last time I went to my uncle's house, we had to drive a long way.
column4: He lives so far out into the country that he still uses an outhouse.
column5: I really needed to use the bathroom, but I didn't want to go into it.
column6: I finally gave in and used the outhouse.
column7: The inside smelled terrible, and I refused to touch the seat.

column3: Mack was a large black lab puppy.
column4: He slept in bed with me every night, but his gas was terrible.
column5: One night, his gas was so atrocious that I moved to the couch to sleep.
column6: I could smell it all the way into the living room.
column7: Eventually he joined me on the couch.

column3: At an eye appointment, my doctor discovered something strange.
column4: He told me my eyes looked very healthy, but they were unusual.
column5: When he used the light to stare into them, there were red streaks.
column6: The streaks are natural pigmentation in my eyes, but it's very rare.
column7: Afterward I started developing green streaks as well.

column3: This morning my husband went to get dressed as he usually does.
column4: He walked into the bathroom and went into his closet.
column5: He picked out the clothing he wanted to wear, and put them on.
column6: When he walked out, he shut the closet door.
column7: The knob, however, was broken and now the door won't open.

column3: My best friend's father was older than most.
column4: He was 73 when she was born.
column5: He had long, black and white hairs in his beard.
column6: His name was Jackson, but everyone called him Jack.
column7: As a result, I started calling him Pepper Jack, like the cheese.

column3: Sam is a 6 year old boy who lives with me.
column4: He was abandoned by his mother, who is my cousin.
column5: Last week she signed temporary custody over to me.
column6: I have been treating him like my son ever since.
column7: He has been playing and having a lot of fun at my house.

column2: The Dog with the Heart of a Lion
column3: My dog died last year from old age.
column4: He was buried under a huge pink rose bush.
column5: We buried him inside his favorite carrier, a red one.
column6: We placed a professionally made stone on his grave.
column7: The inscription said he was a dog with the heart of a lion.

column3: Caleb was diagnosed with Sensory Processing Disorder.
column4: He was freaking out over sensory items and sounds.
column5: He fell to his knees at the loud roar of a motorcycle, covering ears.
column6: He ran to me for comfort afterward.
column7: I held him until he felt better.

column3: I had a dream about a large man with stringy black hair.
column4: He was sitting on top of my chest, staring down at me.
column5: I was awake, with my eyes open, unable to move.
column6: This lasted for about a minute, then I was finally able to move again.
column7: I later found out this was called sleep paralysis.

column3: My son was diagnosed with Autism.
column4: He went to see a top notch child psychiatrist.
column5: They tested him over a course of 3 days.
column6: They played with him and ran tests.
column7: In conclusion, they decided he was PDD-NOS.

column3: My biological father had some chest pains one day.
column4: He went to see his doctor, who told him his heart was enlarged.
column5: He was referred to a hospital in another town.
column6: While there, they found he had severe heart disease.
column7: He ended up dying on the operating table the same day.

column3: One day my brother hit me in the stomach.
column4: He'd done so many times before, but this time I snapped.
column5: I grabbed my little league bat and chased him with it.
column6: I ended up hitting him in the head with the bat twice.
column7: He wasn't really injured, because I was so little.

column3: My mom bought a porcelain dog for the porch.
column4: He's very realistic looking, so he tricked everyone.
column5: People walked up to the door, looked down and jumped.
column6: They thought there was adorable puppy staring up at them.
column7: They laughed when they realized it wasn't real.

column3: On the last trip to the zoo, I took my 11 year old son.
column4: His favorite part was the chinese pandas.
column5: He had never seen them before, as they are rare in the United States.
column6: There were 2 of them, lying around on top of rocks behind glass.
column7: They didn't even look up at us the entire time we were there.

column3: My ex husband has been calling me every day.
column4: I changed my number after he left, but somehow he got it anyway.
column5: He just called me a few minutes ago, and left a message.
column6: I'm thankful he's in another state, so the calls are all he can do.
column7: I worry about him calling me all the time.

column3: When I was 13, my boyfriend's favorite color was purple.
column4: I decided purple was my favorite color too, and painted my bedroom.
column5: Every wall was violet, and I loved it very much.
column6: Then he broke up with me, and I was very sad.
column7: I rebelled by repainting my room neon green, a very ugly color.

column3: I have a fear of severed heads.
column4: I developed it after witnessing the death of one of my best friends.
column5: I have no memory of the accident, but she was beheaded by a semi.
column6: I know I saw it only because others told me I did after the accident.
column7: I never regained my memory of that day.

column2: The Little Brown Desk that Could
column3: I couldn't find a place to put my new computer.
column4: I finally decided to move a small brown desk into my bedroom.
column5: The desk wasn't sturdy at all, but was actually a little wobbly.
column6: I put the computer on top, and used a dining chair to sit in front.
column7: Now I have a work station, even though it isn't a very good one.

column3: I walked out to the tree to look for cicadas.
column4: I found casings they had shed all over the tree.
column5: I pulled them off and inspected them out of curiosity.
column6: They were brown, dry and crumbly.
column7: I put them back on the tree the way I had found them.

column3: My stuffed bear came from the grocery store.
column4: I found him on a sales rack for only $3.
column5: He was brown and fluffy, and wore a purple sleeping cap.
column6: I took him home and placed him on my bed.
column7: I sleep with him and my Charlie Horse every single night.

column3: I learned how to play Rock Paper Scissors when I was an adult.
column4: I got into an argument with my friend, and he suggested we use it.
column5: I had no idea what I was doing, so I lost every turn.
column6: Eventually I got better at it, and won a few rounds.
column7: He gave up after I started winning every time.

column3: I got mad at my brother when I was three years old.
column4: I grabbed a chair and pulled it up to a pencil sharpener in his room.
column5: I methodically sharpened the pencil in the sharpener.
column6: I walked over to my brother and stabbed it into his forearm.
column7: He had a small piece of lead permanently imbedded in his arm.

column3: When I got my brand new laptop, I was ecstatic.
column4: I had saved for months to buy it, and now I had it open in front of me.
column5: When my phone rang, I reached for it without thinking.
column6: I bumped my drink, spilling grape juice all over the laptop.
column7: From that moment on, I've been using a Minnie sippy while I work.

column3: I fell for the cabbage patch kid craze at an early age.
column4: I had several of the dolls, but I decided one day I was going to grow.
column5: I planted cabbage seeds in my grandma's garden.
column6: Every time I visited, I lifted the leaves looking for a new doll.
column7: I finally gave up when the cabbage started to rot away.

column3: The last day of my relationship was a very difficult one.
column4: I had to accept that things had simply changed between us.
column5: I went through the motions of a regular day, but I was heartbroken.
column6: I ended up consoling myself with popcorn and an old sappy movie.
column7: After I had a good cry watching the movie, I felt a little bit better.

column3: In 2014, I stopped at a sanctuary on a job call.
column4: I had to fix a computer for a monk, who made wine and fruit cake.
column5: They sold the wine and fruit cakes locally, so I purchased a cake.
column6: It was the most delicious cake I'd ever had, and I hate fruit cake.
column7: I realized that day that commercial fruit cakes are not the real thing.

column3: I bought my pink phone as soon as it became available.
column4: I had wanted one for a very long time.
column5: When I heard it was out, I rushed to the store.
column6: I purchased one of the only ones they had left in stock.
column7: I paid more for the color, but it was worth it in my opinion.

column3: Windell called me yesterday on my cell phone.
column4: I hadn't heard from him in 20 years, but we picked up like old friends.
column5: He talked about wrestling and his diabetes for most of the call.
column6: We decided to meet and chat about the good old days some time soon.
column7: I hung up feeling better about my hard day.

column3: Yesterday, I suddenly received a text from an old boyfriend.
column4: I hadn't spoken to him since I was 12 years old.
column5: At 35, he was asking me to meet him for lunch in downtown Memphis.
column6: I told him I was unable to, as I am in a serious relationship.
column7: He left me his number in case I ever change my mind.

column3: I had a swimming party at my house one summer.
column4: I invited over lots of different girls from school.
column5: They all came to the party, except one.
column6: She showed up with her parents, because they wanted to meet me.
column7: We quickly became best friends that summer.

column3: I bought a red leather sofa sectional last month.
column4: I paid $500 to purchase it from an elderly gentleman over a weekend.
column5: I picked it up using my minivan, with the seats in the back removed.
column6: I had to take it home in two separate sections because it didn't fit.
column7: When I got it home, it took up a large portion of the living room.

column3: At night time, my mouth was falling open frequently.
column4: I purchased a mouth guard in the hopes it would help.
column5: In the middle of the night, I awoke with pain in my jaw.
column6: I tried changing position several times, to no avail.
column7: I finally removed the guard and gave up.

column3: In the tenth grade, I was terrible at math.
column4: I refused to study, because I didn't think it would do any good.
column5: One morning I had a math test, and I did very badly on it.
column6: When the teacher handed the papers back, I was nervous.
column7: Everyone laughed at me because she x'd two problems, then wrote NO.

column3: I had a lot of difficulty waking up this morning.
column4: I rolled around in bed, frustrated as a song played in my mind.
column5: It was a song by John Lennon, one that never really became popular.
column6: After listening to it in my head for an hour, I gave up and got up.
column7: As I sat at my computer, it continued to be stuck in my head for hours.

column3: My husky sounds like a wolf when she howls.
column4: I sat beside her and howled like a dog.
column5: She got very excited and started howling too.
column6: We sang together for a long time.
column7: It felt like a bonding experience I'll never forget.

column3: I got a new modem for my computer system.
column4: I sat it upon the large cherry wood desk.
column5: The modem was huge, and took up most of the space.
column6: I got everything set up to work properly.
column7: Then I had superfast internet speeds like I always wanted.

column3: I couldn't sleep because my back was hurting.
column4: I tossed and turned for hours through the night.
column5: No matter how tired I was, I just could not sleep.
column6: I tried taking melatonin, and slept like a baby.
column7: I felt really great the next morning.

column3: I visited the beach when I was five years old.
column4: I tried to pick up an egg I saw in the sand.
column5: When I did so, a big seagull began swooping at my head.
column6: It was the mother bird, and she was very angry with me.
column7: I ran as fast as I could to get away.

column3: I had a huge spelling bee coming up, and I represented my school.
column4: I tried very hard to do a good job at the bee.
column5: I had been sick with the flu for weeks, and was very weak.
column6: I attended the county bee despite still not feeling well.
column7: I made it until the end, and lost in state a few months later.

column3: I had never mowed grass before a day in my life.
column4: I walked outside, worried if I could manage it.
column5: I tried starting the mower, and began to push it around the yard.
column6: It turned out to be a lot easier than I thought it would be.
column7: The only issue I encountered was simply that it was very hot that day.

column3: I was not nervous my first day of school.
column4: I was always around other kids, so I wasn't afraid of them.
column5: I was the only kid who didn't cry when my mother left me.
column6: I sat at my desk and played with the toys.
column7: She gave me a big hug at the end of the day, and said I was pretty.

column3: When I was a teenager, my mom and I were going on a shopping trip.
column4: I was really hungry, so I decided to make a snack before we left.
column5: I put a ham and cheese sandwich in the microwave, and asked how long.
column6: Mom thought I meant how long before we left, and said 10 minutes.
column7: I ended up burning my sandwich after putting it in for 10 minutes.

column3: I got mad at my brother one day after school.
column4: I was trying to jump on the trampoline, but he stuck his head under it.
column5: I jumped on it anyway, bouncing up and down on his head.
column6: He yelled for our mom to help him, but I didn't care.
column7: I was so tired of being bullied, it didn't matter anymore.

column3: I got a huge blister from walking for 3 miles.
column4: I wasn't used to the exercise, so it was rough on my feet.
column5: The blister swelled to epic proportions, and began to hurt.
column6: Unwittingly, I popped the blister.
column7: I found out the hard way that popped blisters are very painful.

column3: My first apartment was a run down cheap place to live.
column4: I went to the manager, and was told I could move in right away.
column5: I was in a rush, so I took her up on the offer and moved in.
column6: The rent skyrocketed at the same time that criminals began moving in.
column7: I eventually left, skipping rent, and moved to another state.

column3: I bought some black compression socks today.
column4: I went to the store looking for them this morning.
column5: I put them on up to my knees when I got home.
column6: I hoped they would stop the swelling in my legs.
column7: They are helping a little, but not very much.

column3: I discovered my favorite candy on a class field trip.
column4: In kindergarten, we took a tour of the local grocery store.
column5: On the way out, we were allowed to choose one item from the check out.
column6: I chose bubblegum in a tube that looked like a toothpaste tube.
column7: It was my favorite, and I purchased it for years afterward.

column3: When I was driving down my street one day, I passed a pipe.
column4: Inside the pipe was a head, sitting upright.
column5: Panicking, I pulled over, out of breath and terrified.
column6: I ran out of my car and looked into the pipe, expecting the worst.
column7: Turned out it was just a large doll head that looked real.

column3: I bought a cookie jar just for cookies in our home.
column4: It was a retro Beetlejuice cookie jar.
column5: We put it on the counter, and we can get a cookie every day from it.
column6: Right now it has lots of raisin cookies in it, so we can eat them.
column7: It's keeping the cookies nice and fresh.

column3: Yesterday I tried a new kind of donut.
column4: It was called Crunch, so I thought maybe it was cereal coated.
column5: I was wrong, however, as it had a crumb coating.
column6: It had a strong coconut flavor, which I loved.
column7: I decided I would buy more crunch donuts on my next store trip.

column3: Dubby's car broke down after school one day.
column4: It was called the banana boat, because it was long and yellow.
column5: We couldn't get it to start because it was so old and worn out.
column6: I ended up driving him home that day.
column7: We hung out at his house where we had our first kiss.

column3: We drove to a nearby college to compete in a band tournament.
column4: It was very cold, and we were freezing sitting in our seats watching.
column5: It didn't help that we were drinking concession stand sodas.
column6: I made a friend angry with me, and he threw his cup of soda and ice.
column7: It went all over me and down my shirt.

column3: I got my first rubik's cube for Christmas.
column4: It was wrapped in red and green paper.
column5: I opened it and immediately tried to figure it out.
column6: I worked on it for hours to no avail.
column7: Finally I took all the stickers off and put them where I wanted them.

column3: I found my favorite kind of donut this morning.
column4: It's small and covered with cinnamon.
column5: When I picked it up, I got sugar and cinnamon all over my fingers.
column6: I licked it off because it was so delicious.
column7: I tried really hard not to eat a second one.

column3: I have a few famous friends from my childhood.
column4: Jessica learned how to swim at my house when she was four.
column5: She clung to me and the walls of the pool as she went around them.
column6: She fell under water several times because she'd panic easily.
column7: She learned how to swim pretty quickly.

column3: I ate pizza at the new place with my family.
column4: Later that night, I was watching tv when I began to feel ill.
column5: I became very sick, vomiting and staying in bed for days.
column6: It took over a week to feel better.
column7: By the time it was over, I could no longer stand the sight of pizza.

column3: I bought my son an elf on the shelf at Christmas time.
column4: My elf didn't determine whether he was naughty or nice.
column5: This elf was a trickster, pulling pranks every night while he slept.
column6: The final trick was when he awoke to find his elf proposing to Barbie.
column7: She said yes, and we pretended to have a wedding.

column3: When I was three years old, I still used a binky.
column4: My favorite binky that I used every day said Love Bug on the front.
column5: I walked around with it in my mouth all the time.
column6: I even sucked on it at the dinner table, only taking it out to eat.
column7: I slept with my binky every single night that year.

column3: When I was four years old, I went to a relative's farm.
column4: On the farm, they had all kinds of animals.
column5: I walked behind the horses in the stable one day, and they yelled.
column6: They said not to walk behind the horse, but I wasn't paying attention.
column7: I got kicked by the horse directly in the head, knocking me down.

column3: My great Aunt Hazel was my favorite relative.
column4: One day when I was four years old, we went on a trip to her farm.
column5: She had several goats and pigs on her acreage.
column6: I walked outside all day, looking at the flowers and playing.
column7: I loved petting the pigs and goats at her house that day.

column3: At 11 years old, I always wanted a pet.
column4: One day, a boy rode his bike down my street, with a box in his lap.
column5: He opened the shoe box, and threw out a ferret into the ditch.
column6: I raced out and scooped up the ferret, taking it home.
column7: We called the police, and they said I could keep it.

column3: Dubby was the drummer in a band, and I always went to the practices.
column4: One day, I drove him home from school when his car broke down.
column5: He sat down on his bed facing me, his long blonde hair in his eyes.
column6: He leaned in and kissed me, like it was nothing.
column7: I was surprised, but I kissed him back.

column3: My grandma always wore house shoes.
column4: One day, she was working in her garden while I was playing.
column5: She saw me step on some of her flowers, and yelled at me.
column6: Next thing I knew, her shoe bounced off the back of my head.
column7: I turned to see her standing there with one shoe missing, glaring.

column3: When I played softball, we were always getting injured.
column4: One game, I got injured before it even started.
column5: I ran into the dugout, and slid down the bench to my teammates.
column6: The wooden bench was cracked, and a huge splinter went into my leg.
column7: I had to go to the emergency room to get it removed.

column3: I bought a stuffed toy with purple hair.
column4: She also had purple eyes and eyelashes.
column5: She came with a tiny stuffed baby in her arms.
column6: The baby had a twig of purple curly hair.
column7: The two came as a pair, and are very cute.

column3: My grandma joined a contest in her small hometown.
column4: She believed she had the biggest tree, and wanted to win.
column5: Her tree was humongous, and very old.
column6: She ended up winning the contest, and a check for $100.
column7: A picture was posted in the paper of her holding her check.

column3: Mozie was tired all the time, but today was worse than usual.
column4: She climbed under the deck and went to sleep for most of the day.
column5: All the coaxing in the world did not work to get her to come inside.
column6: It was a very hot day, so we were worried.
column7: Finally, she came back into the house wanting a drink of water.

column3: My three year old cousin came to visit.
column4: She found my sewing supplies and pulled out a needle.
column5: I told her to put it down, but she wouldn't listen.
column6: She stabbed me in the leg with the straight pin.
column7: It hurt very badly, and bled quite a bit.

column3: Pumpkin, my 5 year old pug, just got eye surgery.
column4: She got into a fight with another dog a few days ago.
column5: Her eye got seriously scratched in the fight.
column6: It will be sore for a few weeks, so I'm keeping close watch.
column7: She wants to scratch it, so I put a cone over her head.

column3: My dog is a half wolf, half husky mix.
column4: She has very sharp teeth that got very dirty recently.
column5: I took her to the vet to get them professionally cleaned.
column6: I waited almost an hour for her to come out from the back room.
column7: When they finally came out, they said she did very well.

column3: Cassie was my grey tabby kitten.
column4: She showed up abandoned in front of my house.
column5: She was brought inside, where I fed her and loved her.
column6: As she grew, she liked to play hide and go seek.
column7: Since she was always disappearing, we named her Casper.

column3: For Valentine's Day, my husband surprised me with a new puppy.
column4: She was an eight week old fawn pug.
column5: She was short and pudgy, and loved running around the room.
column6: She begged for a piece of pumpkin pie when I first met her.
column7: Because of this, I named her Pumpkin.

column3: A friend sent me a princess doll for my birthday, even though I 30.
column4: She was beautiful right out of the box, with long red curls.
column5: I placed her on the mantle of my fireplace to admire.
column6: When people come over, they often compliment her shiny porcelain skin.
column7: She sits on the mantle every day, never being moved from position.

column3: Chelsea showed up at my house at 6am.
column4: She was only a little girl, and nobody paid her any attention.
column5: Her mom got up early to play guitar, and would send her out to find me.
column6: We played in the ditch in front of the house that day.
column7: She was tired from not getting enough sleep, but we had a lot of fun.

column3: I took my son to see a speech therapist on Wednesday.
column4: She was very easy going with him.
column5: She helped him with his alphabet for about an hour.
column6: He started to improve by the end of the session.
column7: He had a good session with her, and left happy.

column3: Amber was always drinking at the river that summer.
column4: She would hide her beer from the people camping next to us.
column5: She took a canoe out on the river, but she was too drunk.
column6: She overturned it on a small waterfall.
column7: Her beer floated down the river with her swimming after it.

column3: When my elderly 2nd cousin died, she left behind two birds.
column4: The birds were peach-faced lovebirds, and they were given to me.
column5: I had a cage in my bedroom, but the birds frequently escaped.
column6: I chased them into the living room to try to close them off.
column7: I caught them while they sat on high shelves in the bookcase.

column3: My cell phone fell in the sink while I was doing dishes.
column4: The bubbles wrapped around the phone as it sank into the water.
column5: I pulled it out quickly, afraid it would do damage.
column6: The phone would not turn back on.
column7: I had to leave the house to buy a new one.

column3: I bought a tiny round lip gloss yesterday.
column4: The container was shaped like a cartoon character, drawing me in.
column5: I loved the smell of the gloss, and breathed it in deeply.
column6: After much consideration, I decided to purchase it.
column7: I smiled happily about my gloss as I waited to check out.

column3: When we went to Branson, my son drove a Duck bus.
column4: The driver got out of his seat, and let my son sit down in his place.
column5: He instructed him on how to drive the truck, and we went smoothly.
column6: We floated around in the water, until my son started spinning the boat.
column7: I had to tell him to stop as I realized what he was going to do.

column3: I used to collect colored pencils and erasers.
column4: The erasers came in all kinds of cute shapes and sizes.
column5: I walked to the bookstore in school and bought unicorn erasers.
column6: I did this every week with my allowance.
column7: I collected them all together in a metal tin by Lisa Frank.

column3: When my ex husband moved out, everything was a mess.
column4: The house was dirty and covered in mud from the destruction he caused.
column5: The man next door came over to check on us one day.
column6: When I told him what had happened, he came over and mowed my lawn.
column7: I tried to pay him for it, but he refused.

column3: In 1996, my parents tooks a trip to Europe.
column4: They toured several countries in only a few weeks.
column5: During this trip, they brought back several keepsakes.
column6: They gave me a watch from Switzerland.
column7: The watch was psychedelic and shiny, and I cherish it.

column3: My jelly shoes came from Wal-Mart in a small Arkansas town.
column4: They were cheap, but pink with silver sparkles.
column5: I loved those shoes more than any other at the time.
column6: I wore them to the local park, and accidentally got tree sap in them.
column7: No matter what I tried, the sap refused to clean out.

column3: When I was a little girl, I always wore cute hair clips.
column4: They were multiple colors, and came in shapes of little animals.
column5: I clipped them in my hair at the sides, just above my ears.
column6: I kept the clips so I could always have them.
column7: The clips stayed in my Caboodles kit for years.

column3: I went to a safari with my family.
column4: We bought feed buckets at the front gate from a nice lady.
column5: She filled them up for us to feed the animals.
column6: We drove through the safari feeding all the exotic creatures.
column7: The ostriches snapped and bit my fingers.

column3: We're trying to potty train our new kitty.
column4: We bought her a pretty pink litter box with a lid and sliding tray.
column5: We put her in it every time she eats to see if she will use it.
column6: So far she seems to be getting used to it.
column7: She likes to scratch the sand up behind her.

column3: My great Aunt Hazel lived on a farm.
column4: We drove her home from her sister's funeral about 10 years ago.
column5: That night was the last we would see her in her old age.
column6: We sat at her kitchen table, drinking fresh goat's milk.
column7: It had chunks of fat in it that nauseated me, but it was interesting.

column3: When I graduated high school, my class was only around 300.
column4: We had a fairly normal ceremony, and returned to my parents' house.
column5: Several family members I hadn't seen in years were there.
column6: I had a lot of fun, then drove to my best friend's house.
column7: We ended up spending the night, making pizza and watching movies.

column3: Tabby was one of my best friends, until the day she died.
column4: We left a campground just outside of our town in her mustang.
column5: She turned left onto highway 64, but drifted into oncoming lanes.
column6: The last thing I remember was her looking at me, hand on her chest.
column7: She fell over sideways just before the semi hit, driving over her side.

column3: Big Mama the frog lived with me for a few months.
column4: We put her in a large aquarium in the living room.
column5: We filled it up with rocks and sticks, and a little water.
column6: We bought flies for her from the bait shop.
column7: One day my brother decided to dissect her instead of keeping her.

column3: We went to Silver Dollar City in April.
column4: We rode the trolley to all the little stops inside.
column5: We also played on the go carts, and bumped into each other a lot.
column6: We played games, and ate lots of junk food.
column7: Our favorite was the funnel cakes.

column3: When I was 12 years old, I met a boy who was 19.
column4: We started dating behind my parents' back.
column5: When they found out I had a boyfriend with a car, they were angry.
column6: They told me I could never seen him again.
column7: I never dated him after that, but sneaked out to see him one last time.

column3: I met JC in a forum several months ago.
column4: We started talking about work we did in private messages.
column5: Over time, we starting falling for each other.
column6: We decided to move in together, having never physically met.
column7: We moved across two states to be together.

column3: At a football game, we had to drive 4 hours to reach the destination.
column4: We stopped at a mall food court on the way.
column5: While the band teachers weren't paying attention, we ran.
column6: We ran through the mall screaming loudly.
column7: All of us ended up getting detention.

column3: My husky mix recently started panting for no reason.
column4: We tried everything, but nothing seemed to make her feel better.
column5: Finally, we gave up and took her to the vet.
column6: They ran a test for heartworms, which came back negative.
column7: Eventually, they decided the fleas she's had were stressing her out.

column3: Annette and I were like sisters.
column4: We walked home after school to her house every Friday.
column5: Two boys who lived nearby followed us and whistled every time.
column6: They frequently tried to talk to us and get us to go to their house.
column7: One day we did, but it was so creepy we left after half an hour.

column3: When I was 12, I went to the zoo with my parents.
column4: We walked into a section that had a small area of grass.
column5: I looked into it, expecting to see a tiny rodent of some sort.
column6: Instead, I saw what looked like miniscule deer with long snouts.
column7: I forgot the name of the deer, but seeing one so small shocked me.

column3: Dubby was an amazing friend, who took me to Harrison.
column4: We watched a football game, and it was freezing cold.
column5: I couldn't feel my hands, so I went to the bathroom to warm them.
column6: I ran hot water on them, turning them bright red.
column7: When I came out, he yelled at me for burning my hands.

column3: Leann was a good friend since we were little girls.
column4: We went to college together, and hung out at her house a lot.
column5: I went to her house one day with her roommate, and she didn't answer.
column6: We went to call her parents, but when we returned her car was gone.
column7: Her boyfriend had murdered her, and fled the scene in her car.

column3: Our field trip to Pizza Hut was a lot of fun.
column4: We were allowed in the kitchen, where we were shown how to make pizza.
column5: We each made our own pizzas to cook in the oven.
column6: Since we were little, we weren't allowed to use the ovens ourselves.
column7: We ate in the dining room before going back to school.

column3: Our last field trip was the worst one I'd ever experienced.
column4: We were bussed to the local sewage plant.
column5: We walked in a line along the brown and green sewage.
column6: They explained their jobs to us, but nobody was listening.
column7: We were all so grossed out by the sewage that we didn't pay attention.

column3: When I was 10, I was in girl scouts.
column4: We were invited to march in the local Christmas Parade.
column5: We were all going to wear pajamas like we were going to bed.
column6: I wore a care bear nightgown and carried a stuffed teddy bear.
column7: I was very excited and waved at everyone as I walked past.

column3: Last summer, the kiddo and I went to Branson, Missouri.
column4: We were on an extended vacation.
column5: We drove around town all day, looking for cool things to do.
column6: We stopped at several shows, including the Dixie Stampede.
column7: The boy's favorite was driving The Duck into the river.

column3: I played with toy blocks for a long time.
column4: When I got them, I was really excited.
column5: They were all different colors so I loved to look at them.
column6: I played with them for hours that first day.
column7: I even invited my brother to play with me.

column3: Marion and Louise had a pet parrot named Preacher.
column4: When I walked in, Preacher said hello.
column5: He started learning my name when he saw me.
column6: I walked in one day and he said hello with my name.
column7: I said hello back, and he asked how I was doing.

column3: We had a class field trip to the local shoe factory.
column4: When we got there, I saw my neighbor, who was the manager.
column5: He showed us how they made the shoes in his factory.
column6: At the end of the tour, he gave us all stamped pieces of leather.
column7: I took mine home, but because I'm ASD, I chewed mine up.

column3: Tom was in high school.
column4: He never got in trouble.
column5: One day he was talking to a friend about homework.
column6: The teacher thought he was cheating.
column7: Tom was given detention and had to write an essay.

column3: Josh ordered a new ipad.
column4: He was excited about finally receiving it in the mail.
column5: When he got home, he ran to check the mail.
column6: The box was waiting for him.
column7: He opened it and his ipad was completely shattered.

column3: Tom decided to cook dinner.
column4: He was going to make homemade pizza.
column5: He bought all the ingredients.
column6: However, he grabbed the wrong type of sauce.
column7: It still turned out to taste delicious and everyone loved it.

column3: Jay just turned sixteen.
column4: He was so excited about getting his driver's license.
column5: He had been practicing with his dad every day.
column6: His dad took him to the DMV.
column7: Jay got took his test and he passed.

column3: Zoe has a test tomorrow.
column4: Her best friends birthday party is tonight.
column5: She really needs to study for her test.
column6: However, she does not want to miss the party.
column7: Zoe decides to go to the party and hope for the best.

column3: Jim's teacher assigned his class a 500 word essay.
column4: It was due the next class period.
column5: Jim had already forgotten about the essay when he left class.
column6: When the next class came around, Jim did not have his essay done.
column7: He talked to his teacher and was able to turn his paper in late.

column3: Joe loved his mom's fried chicken.
column4: One day he decided he would try to copy her recipe.
column5: He bought all the ingredients.
column6: He followed each step.
column7: Lo and behold, it turned out perfectly.

column3: Liz and Jake had been together for a year.
column4: One weekend, Jake took Liz on a surprise vacation.
column5: They did many different things and had a great time.
column6: Then one night at dinner, Jake got down on one knee.
column7: He proposed and Liz said yes.

column3: Liz had never played softball for school.
column4: She always played on rec leagues.
column5: This year she decided to try out for her school's team.
column6: Liz was super nervous but gave it her all.
column7: When the team was called out Liz made varsity.

column3: Sue was going to an outdoor concert.
column4: She bought a new outfit in preparation.
column5: However, the concert was rained out.
column6: Sue ended up staying home.
column7: All the money she spent was wasted.

column3: Ashley was excited for prom.
column4: She could not wait to buy her dress.
column5: She and her mom went shopping at many different places.
column6: Ashley finally picked out the perfect dress to wow everyone.
column7: Everyone complimented her and she felt like a princess.

column3: Sue went for a run.
column4: She did not think to check the weather before she left.
column5: As she hit the two mile mark, she heard thunder.
column6: She started to hurry, but it started to pour.
column7: Sue was soaked by the time she made it home.

column3: Liz has a big geometry test tomorrow.
column4: She has been studying all week but still doesn't feel ready.
column5: She got to class and was extremely nervous.
column6: Her teacher noticed how nervous the students seemed.
column7: She decided to move the test to the next day.

column3: Sara could not wait for Christmas.
column4: She knew her mom had been shopping.
column5: One day while her mom was gone, Sara decided to start snooping.
column6: She was curious about her presents.
column7: She found her mom's hiding spot but everything was wrapped.

column3: Joan lived next to a dumpster.
column4: She never thought much about it until one particular day.
column5: She got home from work and noticed a horrible odor.
column6: She could not figure out what it is.
column7: The dumpster had not been emptied for a whole week.

column3: Joe's teacher assigned a reading assignment for homework.
column4: She told the class they may have a pop quiz the next day.
column5: Joe got home and forgot about reading.
column6: When he got to class the next day, he had a quiz.
column7: Joe failed his quiz and his average dropped.

column3: Jan was playing tennis.
column4: She was about to hit the ball when she missed.
column5: However, the missed ball hit her in the head.
column6: Jan thought she was okay but got dizzy.
column7: The doctor diagnosed Jan with a slight concussion.

column3: Joy never got in trouble at school.
column4: She was considered to be the perfect student.
column5: After a long week, she fell asleep in class.
column6: Instead of asking her if everything was ok, the teacher wrote her up.
column7: Joy had never been so embarrassed and luckily got a warning.

column3: Jo was riding a motorcycle with her friend.
column4: She was going too fast down the gravel road.
column5: She hit a pothole all of a sudden.
column6: The motorcycle flipped on the side.
column7: Jo hit her head and had a concussion.

column3: Julie had always made good grades.
column4: She was in high school and knew grades meant a lot.
column5: Julie made a mistake and cheated on a quiz.
column6: Her teacher caught her.
column7: However, she let Julie retake the quiz.

column3: Jenny was starting a new school in the morning.
column4: She was nervous she would not make friends.
column5: When she got to school, she was assigned to a homeroom.
column6: While there, she immediately met a new friend.
column7: Jenny knew this year would be fun.

column3: Sarah wanted to play soccer.
column4: She was not sure if she would be good or not.
column5: Her dad decided to help her with drills.
column6: When tryouts came along, Sarah was ready.
column7: She was excited when she made the team.

column3: Jen ran out of the house with her bag and cup.
column4: She was running late for work.
column5: When she got to work she could not find her cup.
column6: She searched in her car and in her bag.
column7: Then she realized she put it on top of her car.

column3: Sam ordered a cappuccino.
column4: She was too busy talking to remember how hot it was.
column5: As she was driving, she hit a bump.
column6: Hot cappuccino went flying all down her shirt.
column7: Sam got a small burn from the cappuccino and learned her lesson.

column3: The Smiths got a new dog.
column4: The dog did nothing but cry.
column5: The Smiths had to put the dog in training school.
column6: The dog finally learned some lessons.
column7: Now it behaves and listens to commands.

column3: Dan and Ashley had been secretive for a week.
column4: They finally arranged to have their friends over for dinner.
column5: While at dinner they brought out a special cake.
column6: The cake was decorated with baby items.
column7: They announced to their friends they were pregnant.

column3: Tripp and Ashley had been dating for two years.
column4: Tripp decided he no longer wanted to be with Ashley.
column5: He finally got the nerve to break up with her.
column6: She was devastated.
column7: Ashley never saw the break up coming.

column3: Jillian, our neighbor, came over for a couple drinks.
column4: Afterwards she walked around the corner to her home.
column5: After getting home, she decided to drive to the store.
column6: She was still drunk and ran her car off the road.
column7: A cop saw her and wrote her a DUI.

column3: Evelyn and Robert moved into a new home.
column4: Evelyn bought a few houseplants to liven up the place.
column5: Then a friend who was moving away gifted Evelyn some of his plants.
column6: Soon, everyone thought Evelyn was a plant fanatic.
column7: Now, everyone gives Evelyn house plants as gifts.

column3: Stacey got her first credit card.
column4: It was just for emergencies and she would not carry a balance.
column5: Soon, the so-called emergencies mounted up.
column6: Stacey needed another credit card just to deal with all her expenses.
column7: Stacey now has $15,000 of credit card debt.

column3: Paul started a Facebook group to help people with a common interest.
column4: Paul's group grew to have over 3,000 members and many admins.
column5: Paul did not feel the need to consult other admins.
column6: Paul kicked out several people whom he did not like.
column7: The other admins kicked Paul out of his own group.

column3: Stacey and Alvin were getting married soon in Hawaii.
column4: They couldn't afford to pay for everything with cash on hand.
column5: They started to pay for things with credit cards.
column6: They did not communicate about how much they were spending.
column7: After the wedding, they found they had a combined $100,000 of debt.

column3: Todd wanted to go outside and play.
column4: He asked three of his friends if they wanted to play basketball.
column5: They went to the playground and formed two teams.
column6: Todd missed the basket 90 percent of the time when he threw the ball.
column7: Todd ended up throwing the winning shot for his team.

column3: Fred was in the mood to eat some pizza.
column4: He called a local pizza shop but was dismayed at their prices.
column5: Fred decided to make his own pizza.
column6: He found recipes online for homemade dough and sauce.
column7: It was the best pizza Fred had ever eaten!

column3: Mark had a good job that he lost unexpectedly six months ago.
column4: He collected unemployment while looking for a new job.
column5: He went on plenty of interviews but was not optimistic about them.
column6: He jumped for joy when the hospital called him for a second interview.
column7: He was happy to finally be hired as the new night watchman there.
