column4: He was so nervous, his hands were shaking.
column5: He took his violin out and dropped it on the floor.
column6: The wood splintered and the violin was unusable anymore.
column7: Despite this, Gabriel was relieved to have to cancel the concert.

column3: Joseph went to the garage to have his car repaired.
column4: He was told it would take two hours and he sat down on a bench.
column5: After two hours, he was told to wait another half hour.
column6: Joseph was starting to be impatient but waited anyway.
column7: After three hours his car was repaired and he could go home.

column3: Oliver was a male nurse in a big hospital.
column4: He was very efficient and very sought after.
column5: When an old lady was admitted, he took care of her.
column6: But as she had no family, she was all alone.
column7: Oliver went to see her and hold her hand as she died.

column3: Denis wanted to win the race at school.
column4: He wasn't very fast and he wasn't very athletic.
column5: Despite this, he enrolled and run as fast as he could.
column6: People cheered him and he run faster.
column7: At the end, he came in last, but he was proud of himself for trying.

column2: For the love of a lawn
column3: Burt was very proud of his lawn.
column4: He watered it every day and kept it in pristine shape.
column5: That's why he didn't like his neighbor's dog who sniffed around.
column6: He booed him away and didn't often succeed.
column7: Until he gave him food and kept him at bay.

column3: Carl really wanted a promotion at work.
column4: He went to his supervisor and asked what he could do to be better.
column5: His supervisor gave him some pointers and Carl put them into action.
column6: After a few weeks the supervisor was impressed.
column7: And Carl got his promotion as he wished it.

column3: Steve fell in love with a woman who lived very far.
column4: He wrote her emails every day for years.
column5: One day, he declared himself and the woman was delighted.
column6: She felt the same and wanted him to be with her.
column7: So Steve left everything behind for love and moved to be with her.

column3: Teresa wanted to watch her favorite show on TV.
column4: Her brother wanted to watch his favorite show too.
column5: As they only had one TV, they had to decide who would get their wish.
column6: They flipped a coin and called their choice.
column7: When her brother won, Teresa left the room angry.

column3: Jenna was good with numbers and did all her family's taxes.
column4: Her dad wanted to falsify some information.
column5: Jenna refused and held her ground.
column6: Her dad insisted saying he couldn't pay more taxes.
column7: So Jenna invited him to give to charities to pay less.

column3: Yvonne never wore make up.
column4: Her friends told her she should and brought her to the store.
column5: She tried a few shades and chose a light tone color.
column6: But when she arrived home, she threw it in the trash.
column7: Later, when she met her friends, she told them her dog ate it.

column3: Jocelyn lost her husband and cried all the time.
column4: Her friends tried to make her laugh but her pain would not go away.
column5: Jocelyn tried to write down what pained her, but it didn't help.
column6: She also tried to find solace with someone else to no avail.
column7: She only felt better as time went by and her heart healed.

column3: Amelia was a plump young woman.
column4: Her mother always told her that if she was fat she wouldn't marry.
column5: Amelia didn't mind being plump but also trusted her mother.
column6: She went on a diet and lost a few pounds.
column7: But when she didn't find a husband, she went back to eating normally.

column3: Charles was a very serious man and didn't laugh a lot.
column4: His friends tried to tell jokes but he remained untouched.
column5: To make him lose his composure, his friends decided to trick him.
column6: They invited him to a conference which was in a fact a clown party.
column7: Charles wasn't happy, but a smile turned the corner of his lips.

column3: When I was young, my family and I traveled a lot by car.
column4: I loved looking outside and discovering new landscapes.
column5: But no matter what, I always ended up being sick.
column6: My father would have to pull over and I would go out.
column7: When I came back in, I couldn't enjoy the trip anymore.

column3: When I lived up north, I loved springtime a lot.
column4: I used to sing as the ice was melting.
column5: I'd jump over puddles of water with ease and glee.
column6: But since I went south springtime has lost its charm.
column7: And I miss those times when everything felt alive again.

column3: About six months ago, I started doing yoga.
column4: I was very stiff at first but I persevered every day.
column5: I practiced so much that I developed new muscles.
column6: I also found a new emotional balance in my life.
column7: I continue doing yoga as it has brought me so much since I started.

column3: Joseph was really good at driving his taxi.
column4: In fact, he knew all the lights and he could avoid them.
column5: He was so proud, he told so to all his client.
column6: And they all dared him to reach their destination without stopping.
column7: As he always won, his clients had to admit how good he was.

column3: Joan was supposed to work at her novel all night.
column4: Instead she went out with friends and had a good time.
column5: When she went back home, she was too tired to work and went to sleep.
column6: The next day, when she went back to her novel, she was very inspired.
column7: She incorporated events of the previous night and it worked very well.

column3: Tara had a bad knee.
column4: It always hurt very much during a storm.
column5: That day, it was raining a lot and her knee was painful.
column6: She put some cream on it, but it didn't help.
column7: Only when the rain stopped did she find some relief.

column3: Marjorie had very curly hair.
column4: It curled even more every time there was a storm.
column5: When she woke up, it was raining, so Marjorie straightened her hair.
column6: But as soon as she arrived at work, her hair was curly again.
column7: She had to go to the bathroom to straighten it again.

column3: Carlos had one bad tooth.
column4: It hurt him every time he ate something.
column5: Because he was so stubborn, he refused to go to the dentist.
column6: But when the pain became unbearable he had to go.
column7: The dentist removed the tooth and Carlos could eat normally again.

column3: Wilbur was a very patient man.
column4: It took a lot for him to lose his temper.
column5: But when he had waited for four hours in the waiting room, he rose.
column6: He went to the desk clerk, yelled at him, and left.
column7: When he got home, he realized his appointment was for later that day.

column3: Lydia bought a new purse.
column4: It was big and leathery and made everybody look at it.
column5: As Lydia was vain, she liked the attention very much.
column6: Until someone came along and snatched the purse and run away.
column7: Lydia since then buys simple purses and no one notices them.

column3: When Johnny's car broke on the highway, he was stumped.
column4: It was raining very hard and he was far away from a gas station.
column5: He waved for someone to stop.
column6: A big truck stopped and took him along.
column7: When he came back it was dark, but the car got fixed and he left.

column3: During a big snow storm, I woke up one night.
column4: My neighbor's cat was screaming to get in.
column5: After half an hour my neighbor didn't open her door.
column6: As the cat was still screaming for help, I went downstairs.
column7: My neighbor opened the door, she screamed at me, and left the cat out.

column3: Jessica was very soft spoken.
column4: No one could ever hear what she was saying.
column5: One day, for fun, someone stole her lunch at school.
column6: She screamed so much that everyone was stunned.
column7: Jessica got her lunch back but no one dared stealing her lunch again.

column3: Jean didn't want to do her homework.
column4: She asked her little brother to do them for her.
column5: She went with her friend instead and had fun.
column6: When she came back, her brother had finished the homework.
column7: She gave them to her teacher the next day, but got an F.

column3: Lucinda wasn't very bright.
column4: She believed everything people told her.
column5: She thought that left was right and that the sun set in the east.
column6: But even though her brain wasn't very brilliant, she had a nice heart.
column7: She always gave half her lunch to a homeless person without thought.

column3: June was always top of her class.
column4: She didn't even have to study and she'd get A's in everything.
column5: Her parents were very proud but June craved for a B.
column6: Anything to make her feel like she wasn't perfect.
column7: So on her next test, she failed a question, got a B and was happy.

column3: Nina was very bad at cooking but was striving to get better.
column4: She enrolled in a cooking class to learn new recipes.
column5: She learned how to make complicated and tasty dishes.
column6: When she graduated, she invited her friends and cooked for them.
column7: They tasted her food and complimented her on her new skill.

column3: Lena just arrived in the country and was struggling with money.
column4: She found a window cleaner's job but it didn't pay very well.
column5: To supply her income she had to work at night.
column6: But it made her very tired during the day.
column7: To resolve her problem, she found a better paying job.

column3: Karina had her first ballet recital.
column4: She had invited all her friends and family.
column5: As she waited behind the curtain, her heart was beating fast.
column6: She danced nicely in spite of her high level of stress.
column7: At the end, her friends gave her flowers and clapped their hands.

column3: Jenny had great career plans.
column4: She had mapped out her whole future.
column5: When an accident made her an invalid, she lost everything.
column6: She had to plan again and find a new meaning.
column7: With time, she found purpose and is now very fulfilled.

column3: Heather loved to tease Fiona.
column4: She hid her things behind the sofa every time she came to see her.
column5: Fiona was really tired of that behavior and retaliated.
column6: She took some of Heather's things and hid them in her purse.
column7: Heather, mollified, promised to stop and their friendship survived.

column3: Olive was reading a thriller book when she heard a noise outside.
column4: She jumped out of her couch and went to the door.
column5: She looked through the peephole but saw no one.
column6: She called out but no one answered.
column7: Reassured, she went back to her reading, feeling foolish.

column3: Nina was dreaming of world peace her whole live.
column4: She knew she couldn't change the world but made small changes.
column5: She contributed to her community and then to her country.
column6: She came up with so many good ideas, she was congratulated.
column7: She was proud when she received a Nobel prize for her work.

column3: Cecilia was very agile with her hands.
column4: She liked constructing bird cages.
column5: She had many orders from all her neighbors.
column6: But as she worked very slowly, she couldn't fulfill them all.
column7: She had to hired friends to finish her tasks.

column3: Joanna had never played chess before.
column4: She looked at her opponent and felt very impressed.
column5: He thought for two minutes before each move when she moved quickly.
column6: And he took more pieces than her and was going to win.
column7: But in the end, with beginner's luck, she won and cheered.

column3: Olivia went with her iPod everywhere.
column4: She loved listening to music while looking around her.
column5: When a man bumped into her, her earphones fell on the ground.
column6: She bent down to retrieve them but hit her head on the man's head.
column7: When she looked up, she felt her heartbeat and smiled to him.

column3: Caroline was very happy with her white wedding dress.
column4: She loved twirling in it and showing it around.
column5: Her friend asked her to come outside for a picture.
column6: She agreed and walked on the grass.
column7: When she came back home, the bottom of her dress was now green.

column3: Caroline was not a very assertive child.
column4: She never defended her opinions and bent to the will of others.
column5: When she grew up, she was the same.
column6: She didn't like what she had become and decided to change.
column7: Overtime she managed to say her opinions out loud and was proud.

column3: Lilith had to correct a lot of student tests that night.
column4: She prepared her desk with pen and coffee.
column5: But when she was ready to start, a big cockroach ran on her table.
column6: Lilith screamed and all the papers fell on the ground as she stood up.
column7: The cockroach went away, but Lilith had to sort all the papers.

column3: Sonia wanted to make coffee for her mother but didn't know how.
column4: She put all the beans in the coffee machine.
column5: She added some water.
column6: She waited for the coffee to brew.
column7: She was aghast, when at the end, watery beans came out in the cup.

column3: Gina borrowed a new dress from her friend Alexandra.
column4: She put it on and drank some orange juice.
column5: Unfortunately, she spilled some of it on the dress.
column6: She had to clean the stain before giving it back.
column7: But all went fine as Alexandra didn't notice it at all.

column3: Joan was running toward her car when she fell.
column4: She reached for her bag but its content poured on the pavement.
column5: As her neighbor approached to help, she blushed.
column6: He retrieved her diaphragm and gave it to her.
column7: She thanked him and drove away in a hurry.

column3: Maria wore a beautiful new yellow hat with large borders.
column4: She received many compliments and felt very feminine wearing it.
column5: When a gust of wind pushed the hat in the gutter, she run after it.
column6: She retrieved it and saw it was soiled beyond washing.
column7: She had to throw it away and go on without a hat.

column3: Minerva only liked dogs and not cats.
column4: She run a dog shelter and liked to take care of stray dogs.
column5: When a starving cat came to her door and meowed, she froze.
column6: She didn't want to let it in.
column7: But in the end, he heart melted, she fed the cat and kept it with her.

column3: Isabelle was very proud of her long hair.
column4: She took good care of them until she slept on the grass on her lawn.
column5: When she woke up, she realized her hair was full of chewing gum.
column6: She cried and went to her mom.
column7: Her mom cut all of her hair until it was short to the ears.

column3: Lilly went to the store to buy a gallon of milk.
column4: She took the milk and waited in line.
column5: Someone next to her told her it was cheaper elsewhere.
column6: So Lily left the gallon there and drove the other store.
column7: She found the gallon of milk for two dollars cheaper and was happy.

column3: When Lucy went to the pool, there were a lot of kids.
column4: She wanted to play with them but was afraid of the water.
column5: One of the kids gave her some floaters and taught her how to swim.
column6: With effort, Lucy went slowly in the water and floated around a bit.
column7: When she felt more confident, she started swimming and had fun.

column3: Kate didn't have any specialty.
column4: She was good at a lot of things but not perfect at any.
column5: For many years she tried to improve herself in one field.
column6: But despite all her efforts she never succeeded.
column7: She only became happy when she accepted her weakness.

column3: Olive was very happy that day.
column4: She was hopping on the sidewalk with glee.
column5: She took her keys out and threw them in the air.
column6: She caught them put she lost her balance.
column7: She fell on the floor and hurt her hip hard.

column3: Yvonne took the car to go to her class.
column4: She was pressed for time and hurried along the road.
column5: When she saw an old lady crossing the street, she sighed.
column6: The lady was going so slow, Yvonne got out of her car to help her.
column7: When the lady was safely across the street, Yvonne drove away.

column3: Irene was taller than George by five inches.
column4: She was so proud, she kept making fun of him.
column5: When George grew up, he towered her by four inches.
column6: Irene tried to put on some high heels.
column7: But whatever she did, she never got taller than George again.

column3: Suzanne was afraid of the dark.
column4: She was spooked by all kind of noises.
column5: Her neighbor, who knew this, liked to tease her.
column6: He banged her trash can very loud in the middle of the night.
column7: And every time Suzanne would scream and be afraid even more.

column3: Nina didn't like to fly at all.
column4: She was very afraid and didn't like the turbulence.
column5: As she had to fly often for work, she took pills to sleep.
column6: But one day, she forgot her pills and stayed awake during the flight.
column7: She was happy to see the sunset and learned to like flying.

column3: Joanna brought her lunch at school.
column4: She was very ashamed because he mom had made it.
column5: When her friends saw it was healthy food, they laughed.
column6: Joanna blushed deeply but ate her lunch in silence.
column7: Only when her friends were gone did she call her mom to thank her.

column3: Josephine had an unusual long nose.
column4: She was very aware of it and tried to powder it to make it smaller.
column5: As it didn't work very well, people kept looking at her.
column6: Until she found a man with a longer nose and married him.
column7: Since then, people look at both of them and Josephine doesn't care.

column3: Maria loved going to her book club.
column4: She was very involved and read all the books.
column5: Except one time she didn't finish the proposed book.
column6: When it was time to talk about it, she made stuff up.
column7: Everyone agreed with her and she felt like a fraud.

column3: Sonia had a bad limp when she walked.
column4: She was very self-conscious and didn't want to look foolish.
column5: When she was late one day, she had to run.
column6: But because of her limp, she felt silly.
column7: She was reassured when her friend came over and helped her along.

column3: Ursula never thought she'd fall in love.
column4: She was way too unusual to attract many men.
column5: But when she went to her aunt Silvia, she met her neighbor.
column6: He also was an unusual men who didn't attract usual women.
column7: They fell in love and married within a week and are still together.

column3: Barbara went to Paris to take epic pictures.
column4: She went to all the major attractions and immortalized them in print.
column5: She was about to leave when she saw a bird on the ground.
column6: She took a picture and it turned out to be the best one.
column7: Barbara framed it in her apartment and loves this one above all now.

column3: Mary loved painting the countryside.
column4: She went to the country every weekend to do so.
column5: Unfortunately, one day her car broke down in the middle of the city.
column6: She had no choice but go back home and paint from there.
column7: She ended up doing a nice painting of a building and was satisfied.

column3: Marianne was beautiful but had a crooked tooth when she smiled.
column4: She went to the dentist and he put wires in her mouth.
column5: For many years she didn't want to smile.
column6: In fact she hid her teeth with all her might.
column7: When the wire came out, she grinned so much, her teeth gleamed.

column3: Fiona wasn't happy with her face and wanted a change.
column4: She went to the plastic surgeon and asked him for what she wanted.
column5: The surgeon frowned and said it was a lot.
column6: But Fiona was firm and hold her ground.
column7: After the surgery, she looked different, but she liked it.

column3: Lucinda didn't like the sun.
column4: She wore black sunglasses everywhere she went.
column5: Her new boyfriend who liked her eyes asked her to remove her glasses.
column6: When she did, the sun suddenly bathed her face with warmth.
column7: She was so surprised to like it, she threw her sunglasses away.

column3: Mona has been dumped by her boyfriend today.
column4: She's so distressed that she called all her friends.
column5: They are now having a party to help Mona feel better.
column6: But Mona keeps crying and doesn't feel like having fun.
column7: In fact, she prefers to leave and be alone for awhile.

column3: Juniper was very popular at school.
column4: So when a new student arrived, it was up to her to take care of him.
column5: She introduced him to her circle of friends and showed him around.
column6: She even took him to the school dance so he wouldn't feel alone.
column7: The new student was so grateful, he bought her flowers.

column3: Gregory had never taken a train in his life.
column4: So when he was on his first train, he was surprised how fast it went.
column5: He looked outside the window and everything was a blur.
column6: When he climbed down, he was very satisfied.
column7: He decided to do all his travel by train from now on.

column3: Greg bought a dog.
column4: The dog loved to play in the mud and was always sloppy.
column5: Greg took him home and gave him a bath.
column6: But as soon as he walked his dog again, the dog run in the mud.
column7: Greg fenced his courtyard and made sure there was no mud in it.

column3: Lilly went out despite the bad weather.
column4: The hail was strong and she feared to be hit badly.
column5: She run to her car and went inside just in time.
column6: As she sat on her seat, a big golf size ball of hail hit her car.
column7: She was very relieved to be inside and drove out very slowly.

column3: Natalie had her hair recently done by a famous hairdresser.
column4: The perm didn't fit her well and the die made her look sick.
column5: She hid in her home a whole weekend before finding a solution.
column6: She went to a store and bought a different die.
column7: She cut her hair short and finally could go out again.

column3: Norman threw a party for all his friends.
column4: They danced all night and had a lot of fun.
column5: But around midnight, Norman started screaming.
column6: A big rat was running in the middle of the room.
column7: Everyone left in panic and Norman was alone with the rat.

column3: Fred was very much in love with Sarah.
column4: They did everything together and were a great couple.
column5: One day though Sarah broke up with Fred.
column6: He couldn't cope with it and wallowed in sadness.
column7: Ten years later, he's still alone as he couldn't find love again.

column3: An atheist woman and a christian woman met every week for tea.
column4: They liked to discuss the world and their vision of it.
column5: They often disagreed on many subjects.
column6: But when it came to helping others, they thought the same way.
column7: They always ended up giving one dollar to a homeless person after tea.

column3: Jeff and Bert were twin brothers.
column4: They liked to play pranks on people.
column5: They interchanged their names often to confuse them.
column6: And when it was time to assign blame, they denied everything.
column7: Eventually, no one liked them and they were alone.

column3: Matt and his two brothers liked to wrestle a lot.
column4: They were always coming back home full of mud.
column5: Their mother told them many times to stop.
column6: But the three brothers still fought and soiled their clothes.
column7: Their mom bought them special clothes and the matter was resolved.

column3: Stephan like to dress very well to impress his friends.
column4: To do so, he shopped in the best quality places on a popular street.
column5: He then dressed himself with care and went out with his friends.
column6: Except one day, he had no more clean clothes.
column7: He chose old clothes and felt foolish when he met his friends.

column3: When I was ten, I went on a trip with my family and my uncle.
column4: We had a lot of fun until one night there were beets on the table.
column5: I found them weird and didn't want to try them.
column6: My uncle forced me to try and no one stopped him.
column7: Since then, I still can't eat beets as it reminds me of my uncle.

column3: Wilfred was a good and loving father.
column4: When he took ill and went to bed early, his kids were worried.
column5: They prepared him breakfast the next day.
column6: And stayed by his bedside telling him stories.
column7: When he got better, he took his kids out to the fair to thank them.

column3: Gina had just given birth and was very tired.
column4: When her baby started to cry during the night, she couldn't hear it.
column5: Her husband tried to wake her up but she wouldn't move.
column6: So he went to feed the baby and went back to bed.
column7: In the morning, Gina was so touched, she hugged her husband very hard.

column3: The dead dog rotted in the woods.
column4: A bird of prey spotted the dog.
column5: It started eating the dog.
column6: Another bird saw the dog.
column7: The two birds fought over the meat.

column3: Mike drove down the left lane.
column4: A car approached him from behind.
column5: Mike got in the left lane to let the car pass.
column6: The driver in the car passed Mike.
column7: He waved at Mike as he passed.

column3: The cop sat at his speed trap.
column4: A car came buy driving twenty miles over the speed limit.
column5: The cop chased the car.
column6: The car pulled over.
column7: The cop gave the owner a ticket for seven hundred dollars.

column3: The spider made a web.
column4: A deer knocked over the web with his head.
column5: The spider fell on the deer.
column6: The spider lowered himself from the dog with a strand of web.
column7: The spider went back to fix his old web.

column3: Owen put on his baseball cap backwards.
column4: A stranger told him to wear his hat correctly.
column5: Owen turned his hat forwards.
column6: He got out of the stranger's sight.
column7: Owen turned his cap back to backwards.

column3: The fleet of ships advanced towards the island.
column4: A submarine snuck up on them.
column5: The submarine fired a torpedo at one of the ships.
column6: The ship exploded.
column7: The other ships in the fleet scattered.

column3: Justin asked Abby to the dance.
column4: Abby looked surprised at Justin.
column5: Justin started to walk away.
column6: Abby ran up to him.
column7: Abby put his hand in hers.

column3: Alex bought a new necklace.
column4: Alex put it on the outside of his shirt.
column5: A woman admired the necklace.
column6: Alex ignored her.
column7: The woman looked dejected into the distance.

column3: Adele wrote a song.
column4: An editor reviewed the notes.
column5: He suggested two changes.
column6: Adele incorporated the changes.
column7: The editor felt important around his peers.

column3: Jessie played poker at the bar.
column4: Another player accused him of cheating.
column5: Jessie yelled at the player.
column6: The other player got up and left.
column7: The rest of the table decided to quit the game as well.

column3: Frank carried a tray of food towards the table.
column4: Another waiter ran into him.
column5: Frank almost spilled all of the food.
column6: He set the food on the table.
column7: He told his customers that he had almost dropped all of their food.

column3: Arthur wrote his last will and testament.
column4: Arthur's brother got arrested for domestic abuse.
column5: Arthur took his brother out of his will.
column6: Arthur died one morning.
column7: Arthur's sister got all of his inheritance.

column3: Ralph opened his market.
column4: At noon a man with a mask walked in.
column5: He pointed a gun at Ralph.
column6: Ralph gave the man the money from the register.
column7: The man left without hurting Ralph.

column3: The men watched Axel.
column4: Axel knew that they were watching.
column5: The men had very little to do.
column6: They assigned shifts for each man.
column7: On one shift Alex did nothing all day.

column3: Don parked his camper at a busy campground.
column4: Don talked to people passing by about his religion.
column5: One family was interested in what he had to say.
column6: The family joined Don's religion.
column7: Don reported his success to the local parish.

column3: Willie got a new guitar for his birthday.
column4: Every day after school he practiced the guitar.
column5: He was invited to play in a talent show.
column6: Willie played his guitar at the talent show.
column7: He surprised the crowd with his good play.

column3: Graham put his new product idea on a crowdfunding site.
column4: Graham raised five thousand dollars for his product idea.
column5: He delivered the first of his new product to his customers.
column6: He got sued for product infringement.
column7: He lost all of his money in the lawsuit.

column3: Doug moved his piece into check.
column4: Greg informed Doug of his mistake.
column5: Doug took the move back.
column6: Doug could not find any other good moves.
column7: Doug conceded the game to Greg.

column3: Betty drew a picture in her notebook.
column4: Greg saw the picture over her shoulder.
